Description: Syrah and Mourvèdre give structure and perfume to this dense wine. With spice, vanilla and intense red fruits, the wine is ripe, full and laced with acidity. Drink this rich wine from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Paradis 2020 Terre des Anges Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese and from the Biondi Santi BBS 11 clone, this radiant, medium-bodied rosato offers heady aromas of forest berries and cedar with whiffs of Mediterranean herbs. On the savory, tangy palate, mouthwatering acidity accompanies strawberry compote, orange zest and fennel.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Montepò 2019 Jet Sangiovese Rosato (Toscana)

Description: Rose petals and kirsch liqueur perfume this deeply hued, red-berried blend of Grenache, Cinsault, Clairette, Syrah and Picpoul. Full bodied and deeply concentrated in fresh, sun-kissed red-plum and blackberry flavors, it's a juicy, fruit-focused dry rosé that finishes on elegant notes of crushed limestone and salt. Delicious in any season, it should maintain at peak well through 2022.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine des Carteresses 2020  Tavel

Description: With 70% Syrah in the blend, this wine has a rich texture and hints of tannins. It is dense with red-berry fruits, acidity and good concentration. This wine could age for a while, so try waiting to drink until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Fonscolombe 2020 Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's just a tinge of color to this wine, so little that some might mistake it for a white wine. The aromas offer pleasing notes of strawberry and rhubarb alongside a whiff of bubblegum. The palate is bone-dry and richly flavorful, with a big blast of puckering acidity tying it all together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: And Why Am I Mr Pink
Name: Underground Wine Project 2020 And Why Am I Mr Pink Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Côtes de Provence La Londe, Provence, France
Description: This cru region within Côtes de Provence is noted for rich rosés, such as this one. This wine is dense, packed with red fruits and ripe with peppery Grenache. Red-currant acidity brings freshness at the end. Drink from late 2021. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château les Mesclances 2020 Faustine Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rare for a rosé, this light-pink and light-bodied wine tops its fresh ginger and persimmon flavors with subtle oak spices like nutmeg and vanilla from being barrel fermented and aged on the lees. It's smooth on the palate and lingering on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Starfield 2019 Cinsault Rosé (El Dorado)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Vibrant raspberry and cassis flavors abound in this thirst-quenching, dry rosé composed of 70% Grenache, 20% Cinsault and 10% Syrah. It's fresh and pure in fruit but intensely mineral too, finishing on a long, exhilarating spray of cut stone and salt.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: E. Guigal 2019 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

Description: The estate wine from this property, this is a blend of Syrah and Grenache. Ripe red-berry fruits are shot through with fresh, tangy acidity. With the fruitiness fully expressed, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Paradis 2020 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Syrah makes up 90% of this wine, with the rest Sangiovese. Quite pale in color, the aromas offer notes of strawberry and cherry. A flavorful palate follows, with a zip of acidity. A portion of proceeds go to fighting cancer.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: City Limits 2020 Pink Street Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's nothing typical about this yellow-orange-pink blend of 50% Grenache, 15% Grenache Blanc, 12% Cinsaut, 12% Mourvèdre, 8% Carignane and 3% Roussanne, which is aged in five-gallon glass demijohns and stirred monthly. Aromas of dried and rainy cement and orange peel lead into a very grippy and savory palate, full of more citrus peel, rocky earth and slightly nutty flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bonny Doon 2016 Vin Gris de Cigare Reserve Rosé (Central Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight aromas of watermelon and peach are generous but well restrained on the nose of this rosé made from Tempranillo. There is a buoyant zip to the palate, where a tense structure readies the palate for flavors of orange peel, pluot and wet granite.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: ONX 2019 Indie Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: While almost colorless and smelling of peach pit and petrol, this feels chiseled and racy, with prickle and pop. Dry peach-pit bitterness and citrus flavors come with yeasty backing notes, while this shows additional depth and yeasty complexity on a dry finish with an autolysis note normally found in Champagne and other classic method sparklers. Drink through 2021.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Muga 2019 Flor De Muga Rosé (Rioja)

Description: This perfumed, deep-pink rosé is a consistently well-made expression of Tavel. Whiffs of caramelized sugar, rose petal and red currant accent rich, concentrated flavors of cherry sorbet and fresh strawberries. Full bodied and fringed by delicate tea tannins, it's a refreshing but solidly built dry wine that drinks well year round.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Chantepierre 2020  Tavel

Description: With an attractive hint of pepper as well as fresh red fruits, this is a softly textured and fruity wine. The acidity brings with it orange zest and a bright aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Fonscolombe 2020 Esquisse Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Description: Balanced, fresh and fruity, this wine is bright with red berries lifted by the acidity. It is crisp and textured, with lightly structured, perfumed Mourvèdre that gives a final flourish. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château les Mesclances 2020 Cuvée Saint Honorat Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Appellation: Les Baux de Provence, Provence, France
Description: From vines growing atop Les Baux estate of Mas de la Dame, this wine has a structured component of Syrah to give richness. Herbal edging to the acidity and a fresh raspberry aftertaste add contrast. Drink now. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Nos Vins du Sud 2020 L'Arlésienne Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump aromas of melon are cut by a racy slice of Ruby Red grapefruit peel on the nose of this Mourvèdre-based rosé, which also includes 18% Grenache and 7% Cinsaut. There's a firm tension to the palate, where bitter orange flavors balance the riper peach and plum fruits.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Le P'tit Paysan 2020 Pierre's Pirouette Rosé (Central Coast)

Description: A new release from the estate, this is a ripe blend of Syrah, Grenache and Vermentino, giving both richness and attractive, fruity crispness. The wine finishes with lively citrus acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Paradis 2020 Claire-Voie Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Description: Bright fruit and tangy acidity are hallmarks of this crisply textured wine. Freshness and acidity make the wine ready to drink. It comes in a skittle-shaped bottle, traditional but rare to see now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Ravel 2020 Château Montaud Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Description: A ripe, attractively fruity and richly textured wine, this bursts with energy and layers of red berries. The mineral edge and tight acidity contrast with the richness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Sainte Marguerite 2020 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Description: This aptly named Bird of Paradise wine is dominated by Syrah, giving both perfume and a light structure. With the acidity and spiciness, the wine is both fruity and textured. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Paradis 2020 Oiseau du Paradis Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Description: This invigorating rosé is a dusty-pink blend of Syrah and Mourvèdre. Raspberry and watermelon flavors are zesty and cutting, edged by crushed mineral and salt as well as lingering, thirst-quenching acidity. It would be lovely on a summer afternoon but also drinks well year round.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2020 Cape Bleue Rosé (Mediterranée)

Appellation: Coteaux Varois en Provence, Provence, France
Description: With a majority of Grenache in the blend, this wine is full of red-fruit flavors, with just a bite of pepper. Textured and fresh, the wine also has a salty, tangy character. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Grand Vigne 2020 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

Description: Bright red fruits and a crisp texture give this wine light fruitiness. It has a rapier-like freshness, finished with acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château les Mesclances 2020 Romane Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Description: This Rioja rosé is paler than some white wines, with airy aromas of cantaloupe and underripe peach. A smooth and round palate offers enough acidity to maintain freshness. Dry orange, papaya and white-bread flavors set up a finish with tannic build up and mild burn; drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2019 Rosado (Rioja)

Description: This dusty-pink Pinot Noir rosé offers perfumed notes of cherry blossom and fresh raspberry backed by revitalizing acidity and a backbone of stony minerality. Slim and brisk in profile, it's a well-priced, consistently tasty sip that's refreshing year round.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2019 Pinot Noir Rosé (Pfalz)

Description: This pale-salmon-colored wine has a lot of winey character, meaning it offers substantive plum fruit and rather full body complemented by a smooth texture. Not a light refresher but it is a very good mealtime wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Voyager Point 2019 Rosé (California)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This blend of 59% Chardonnay and 41% Pinot Noir starts off with ripe aromas of yellow apple, pear and white plum, with a flower blossom tone lingering in the background. Tiny bubbles form a creamy mousse on the palate, where more rich fruit flavors are framed in a lightly astringent grip. It's a full-bodied, rounded traditional-method sparkler.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: Noblesse Oblige Extra Brut Méthode Traditionelle
Name: Wölffer 2017 Noblesse Oblige Extra Brut Méthode Traditionelle Rosé (Long Island)

Description: Dusty, yeasty aromas soften red-berry and cantaloupe scents, while this is medium in body and in balance. Slightly bitter flavors of peach pit and grape skins are fresh and cleansing through a sprightly finish. Drink through 2021.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ilurce 2019 Rio Madre Rosado (Rioja)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This sparkling rosé made from Cayuga White and Vincent is juicy and fruity, with flavors of cherry and blackberry juice. It's semidry in style yet nicely balanced by bright acidity and zesty bubbles.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Glenora NV Traditional Method Sparkling Rosé (Finger Lakes)

Description: Recalling cool breezes from the Atlantic Ocean, this wine is fresh and tightly crisp. The perfume of red-berry flavors and lively acidity pops out of the glass. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2020 Océanide  (Saint-Mont)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This soft and ripe wine from the northern part of Gascony is gently fruity, ripe with strawberry flavors and with a fresher touch of acidity at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2020 Domaine de Cassaigne Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Hearty, fruity flavors of raspberry, watermelon and peach skin fill up this medium-bodied wine, which has a good, grippy texture and decent acidity for balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: California Refined 2019 Rosé (California)

Description: Dusty yeast and slightly chunky apricot and cantaloupe aromas come in front of a palate that offers average zest but not much depth. Slightly bitter flavors of grape skins and stone-fruit pit finish wet and fresh, but basic. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: El Coto 2019 Rosado (Rioja)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This pale-colored rosé is packed with the freshest, crispest red-berry flavors. The bright and breezy wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2020 Colombelle Tannat-Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: A crisp, bright and fresh wine, tangy with acidity and orange zest. Hints of red fruits and the light spritz of this medium dry wine make it very drinkable immediately.                      Roger Voss
Name: Adega Ponte da Barca 2020 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Light and fruity, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot is full of spicy freshness and crisp acidity. This vibrant wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Guillaman 2020 de Presse Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This seductive, complex wine made from Sangiovese and Zinfandel grapes offers fragrant raspberry, new leather and sandalwood aromas and tangy fruit flavors shaded by earthy, woodsy accents. Medium body and a smooth texture make it drink almost like a red.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sottomarino NV Rosé (Lake County)

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Dry and salmon-pink in hue, this full-bodied rosé offers flavors of raspberry and red-cherry candies edged by a crystalline mineral crush. Fresh-fruited and briskly concentrated, it's an easy-drinking, revitalizing blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Mas Carlot 2019 Générations Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

Appellation: Sierra Pelona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh strawberries, rose petals and tart lime aromas pair with chalk and wet earth on the nose of this bottling from a unique corner of Southern California. Crushed chalk flavor and texture lead the palate, alongside lime pith and creamy pink fruits, with a kick of mint.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Agua Dulce 2019 Rosado Seco Rosé (Sierra Pelona Valley)

Description: Voluptuous on the palate and concentrated in black-cherry and strawberry flavors, this penetrating dry rosé offers the power of a red wine fused with the vitality of a white. It's a buoyantly fruity, ruby-hued sip that finishes on wisps of sweet spice and burnt sugar. It will be delicious now through 2022, at any time of the year.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Vignobles et Compagnie 2019 La Vigne du Roy  (Tavel)

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Crisp red cherry and orange blossom perfume this thirst-quenching, dry blend of Grenache (60%) and Syrah (40%). Pale pink in hue, it's a concentrated, juicy rosé marked by bright strawberry and raspberry flavors and a revitalizing mineral lift.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château de Fabregues 2019 Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An orange shade of pink in the glass, this rosé of Pinot Noir begins with light raspberry and talc aromas, with the red fruit growing stronger toward cherry as it sits open. The palate ranges from richer baked raspberry to lemony citrus flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lightpost 2018 La Grande Sofi Sparkling Rosé (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: A delicate floral perfume extends from nose to finish in this dry, dusty-pink rosé. While full bodied and voluminous on the palate, its watermelon and red-cherry flavors are almost diaphanous in concentration. Thirst quenching and mineral, it finishes on a lingering tang of salt.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Mas Carlot 2019 L'Irresistible Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Shards of cut stone and freshly picked raspberries abound in this full-bodied, mineral rosé. While plush and voluminous on the palate, it's a dry, freshly balanced blend of Grenache (50%), Syrah (30%) and Cinsault (20%) edged by hints of caramelized sugar and spice.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Mas des Bressades 2019 Cuveé Tradition Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

Description: Almost ruby in color, this robust dry rose is packed with pert red-cherry and raspberry flavors. It offers plenty of sunny, penetrating red-fruit as well as nuanced shades of dried garrigue and crushed earth. This stately year-round rosé will please both red and white-wine lovers alike.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château de Trinquevedel 2019  Tavel

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An electric shade of pink in the glass, this rosé is jubilant in aromas, offering ripe cherry as well as wet earth on the nose. There's a touch of rusty minerality on the palate, where the cherry and rose flavors are bold but balanced.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ragtag 2019 Santa Margarita Vineyard Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: Tasted in January of 2021, this moderately full-bodied, ruby-hued rosé still offers bright, juicy raspberry and red-cherry flavors accented by delicate thyme and bramble tones. Dry and solidly structured, it's a year-round rosé that's best enjoyed soon.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Cellier des Chartreux 2018 Domaine Les Hautes Roches  (Tavel)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a rare in the state blend of red and white wines. Light watermelon in color, with aromas of cherry and dried rose petals followed by light, mouthwatering cherry and orange rind flavors.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Category 5 NV The Hacker Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This full-bodied, fresh-fruited rosé balances ripe, concentrated red-cherry and strawberry flavors against smokier undertones of crushed earth and burnt sugar. Salmon-pink in hue, it's an immediately appealing, juicy sip with an invigorating mineral finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Vignobles et Compagnie 2019 Château des Sources Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

Description: Crushed granite and peppery spice mingle into ripe strawberry and red-currant flavors in this deeply hued, dusty-pink rosé. A 90/10 blend of Grenache and Syrah, it's a dry but approachably juicy sip brightened by a tang of mineral freshness on the finish. Best enjoyed soon.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Les Vignerons du Castelas 2019 Respelido  (Tavel)

Description: Pale orange in color and showing some bricking, with aromas of watermelon and cherry followed by dry, medium-weight flavors. It's not entirely pleasing to the eye, but the palate delivers plenty to enjoy.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Mastrogiannis 2019 Rosé For Cure Rosé (Washington)

Description: A perfumed wine with a touch of Moscatel, it's fresh while having a rounded, fruity character. Red berries and lychee fruits give crispness at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Sanguinhal 2019 Quinta das Cerejeiras Rosé (Lisboa)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is a brilliant light copper in color and offers scents of peach and flint followed by nicely concentrated fruit flavors and a smooth texture. The acidity is subtle, giving a full mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: William Gunn 2019 Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This is a crisp, young, red-fruit-flavored wine. Bright acidity is tempered by weight and richness, and the contrast works well. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Freynelle 2020 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: Flowery, yeasty aromas settle on peach pit and dustiness. A citric-leaning palate is bright but shows depth and conveys a sense of quality. Orange and grapefruit flavors finish juicy and tart.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Casablanca 2020 Céfiro Cool Reserve Pinot Noir Rosé (Casablanca Valley)

Description: The estate in Lussac Saint-Emilion has produced a perfumed, 100% Cabernet Franc rosé. It is rich and dense, with juicy red fruits laced with orange-zest flavors. The weight of the ripe fruit is just balanced by acidity at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château des Landes 2020 Les Caprices d'Anaïs Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: Ripe and full of red fruits, the wine is produced from 100% perfumed Touriga Franca. The wine is smooth and rounded, with an attractive touch of acidity to give it a lift. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lavradores de Feitoria 2019 Rosé (Douro)

Description: Ample peach aromas and fresh apple flavors give a lot of fruitiness to this light-bodied, very pale-pink wine. Its freshness and crisp texture are charming.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Grove 2020 Family Reserve Winemaker's Rosé (California)

Description: Bright and fresh aromas of strawberry and candied watermelon make for an inviting entry to this bottle. Lemon-peel and candied berry flavors show on the palate, which has a slightly vinous tone and is flat in texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: José Rosé NV Pink Agua Rosé (California)

Description: This ripe wine has plenty of crisp acidity to go with the light texture from Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. It has a fragrant, fruity aftertaste. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Nicot 2020 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: Bready yeast and sweet citrus blossom aromas are imprecise, while this rosé of Pinot Noir feels punchy and citric but also a bit heavy. Orange and tangerine flavors diminish quickly, leaving mild pithy bitterness on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Garzón 2020 Reserva Pinot Noir Rosé (Uruguay)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This sturdy, light-bodied wine is straightforward in flavor and nicely tangy in texture. It shows almost no pink color, and has lean melon and apple flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: RD 2019 Fifth Moon Rosé (El Dorado)

Description: A fruity wine, full of attractive red berry fruits, topped with cherry and the brightest acidity. It is crisply textured and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Sanguinhal 2019 Cerejeiras Rosé (Lisboa)

Description: Mainly Merlot with a goodly dash of Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine brings red fruits and young freshness to the glass, with a bright red-currant aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut Pasquet 2020 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: A yeasty nose smells powdery and vaguely fruity, while this feels raw and citric, with sharp acidity. Stalky citrus flavors shows a pyrazine element. The finish is lean.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2020 Los Vascos Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Briny citrus and stale melon aromas introduce a lazy palate with low acidity. Sleepy, somewhat bitter stone fruit flavors fade out with marginal clarity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vik 2020 La Piu Belle Rosé (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: One of the better rosés of the vintage, this bottling, which features artwork by actor Billy Zane, begins with crisp and chalky aromas of rose and melon on the expertly crafted nose. There is extraordinary grip on the sip, with pleasantly subtle melon and pluot flavors leading into a rose-petal finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Paradise Springs 2019 Pink Ash Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hood is the second label for Top Winery founder Stanley Barrios, and its graffiti-sporting label is a nod to his South Los Angeles roots. The wine is a yellowish-pink in the glass, offering aromas of chalk, orange pith and peach. The grippy, crisp palate presents flavors of Meyer lemon skin, tart pluot and a mineral hint of ash.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hood 2019 Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: Minerally but mouthwatering, with touches of strawberry and spice, this pour is both fun and elegant. It has a delicious balance between bright acidity and juicy fruit, with a lingering salty, seashell finish.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Wine Art Estate 2019 Pink Bang Rosé (Drama)

Description: Beautiful aromas of zesty citrus and red berries lead into a lively and elegant mix of spice, mineral and fruit. The wine finishes with sea salt and citrus rind.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Domaine Papagiannakos 2019 Granatus Rosé (Attica)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Rex Hill's rosé is as good as it gets in Oregon. The fun begins with the clear bottle, covered with embossed white flowers, that lets the pretty coral color of the wine show through (just keep it away from any sunlight). Strawberries and cocoa powder flavors shine here, with an appealing dusty character and a layered, lingering finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Rex Hill 2019 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Description: Dusty pink in hue, this cutting, mineral rosé offers brisk sour cherry and raspberry flavors edged by shards of cut slate and earth. It's a racy, especially light-bodied sip with a bracing, juicy finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ökonomierat Rebholz 2019 Spätburgunder Trocken Rosé (Pfalz)

Description: Black cherry candy and rose petals perfume this svelte but deeply concentrated Pinot Noir rosé. Bone-dry yet plump, it's a juicy, thirst-quenching sip packed with black plum and berry flavors etched by a smoky minerality. A solid evergreen rosé that should drink beautifully year-round.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schäfer 2019 Made With Organic Grapes Dry Rosé (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a unique style of rosé, using the barrel to unleash a smokier edge to the 50–50 blend of Grenache and Syrah, and it works. Aromas of strawberry, melon and grapefruit peel lead into a lightly smoked palate, where fatter strawberry and roasted apple flavors emerge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Centralas 2019 Hussy Barrel-Aged Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This is a zippy, delightfully raspberry-scented Pinot Noir rosé. Bone-dry yet deeply concentrated, with ripe, juicy blackberry and cherry flavors, it's a firmly structured sip that can stand up to colder weather and sturdier fare like game or salmon. Finishes long on delicate tea tannins and a kiss of smoky spice.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Von Buhl 2019 Bone Dry Rosé (Pfalz)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh strawberry and lemon-pith aromas meet with chalk and Ruby Red grapefruit on the nose of this rosé. There's a compelling grip to the sip, where rounded strawberry flavors are prominent but held in check by the texture and acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Summerland 2019 Rosé (Central Coast)

Description: Savory and fruity aromas are followed by mouthwatering, spicy strawberry and vanilla flavors. The wine has a an herbal touch that gives it weigh and complexity. The finish is long and full of spice.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Gaia Wines 2019 14-18h Agiorgitiko Rosé (Peloponnese)

Description: Poised, flinty, fresh and spicy, this wine starts with strawberry, raspberry and rhubarb aromas, followed by pert cherry flavors and a spicy finish. This is an interesting and successful marriage of juicy but dry complexity.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Zacharias 2019 St. George Rosé (Peloponnese)

Appellation: Malibu Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Candied cherry aromas meet with more elegant lines of rose water on the nose of this somewhat darkly shaded rosé. There's a touch of roasted strawberry on the palate, as well as more cherry, with a decent tension. It's an excellent pairing for a sunset over Malibu beaches.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: AJA Vineyards 2019 Rosé (Malibu Coast)

Description: Full-bodied with a tart and tangy back palate, this wine offers raspberry, juicy watermelon and spice flavors. Pair this pour with cheeses and dried meats.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Palivou 2019 Vissino Rosé (Peloponnese)

Description: This rosé starts off clean and stony on the nose then turns lively and citric on the palate. Salt and citrus juice flavors carry it along, while a lemon peel note marks the steady finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: La Maldita 2019 Garnacha Rosé (Rioja)

Description: Coming from an Idaho producer, this pale salmon wine with a gold tinge could be varietally labeled as Mourvèdre. The aromas bring notes of apple and raspberry leading to tart, medium-bodied flavors. There's a lot to like.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Huston 2019 Chicken Dinner Rosé (Washington)

Description: A light tan color and melony aromas touched up by a note of honey open this claret style rosé that's made from 75% white Viura and 25% red Garnacha. A fresh, pinchy palate comes with citric acidity and flavors of tangerine and apple that hint at bitterness on a solid finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ramirez de la Piscina 2019 Rosado (Rioja)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale pink with an orange tint, this wine is 70% Cinsault and 30% Grenache. Aromas of strawberry and peach are followed by full feeling flavors that show some sweetness but with enough acidity to pull it off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Callan 2019 Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A beautiful copper color and rich fruit and spice aromas provide a great entry to this lush, broad-textured wine. It offers toasted bread and baking-spice flavors to complement a peach and cherry core.                      Jim Gordon
Name: E16 2019 Sparkling Rosé (Fair Play)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A slightly darker shade of orange-pink in the glass, this rosé blend of 54% Grenache, 23% Cinsault and 23% Syrah offers dried cherry, cola and orange rind on the nose. The palate shows dried berry, citrus peel and a hint of savory herbs.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lion Ranch 2019 Lioness Rosé (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: This wine offers fleshy white fruit, spice and sea salt on the nose. The wine's character is earthy, with herbs and a touch of smokiness mingling with fresh-fruit flavors. It's unique and food-driven overall.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Designation: La Vie en Rose Moschofilero Dry
Name: Palivou 2019 La Vie en Rose Moschofilero Dry Rosé (Peloponnese)

Description: A rusty deep-orange color and aromas of stone fruits, carrot juice and yeasty vanilla lead to a medium-to-full palate that's flush and plump by rosé standards. Nonspecific citrus and generic melon flavors turn slightly bitter on a chunky finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Faustino 2019 VII Rosé (Rioja)

Description: Fresh cherry and floral flavors give this light-bodied wine a jammy touch, while a rather soft effervescence makes it easy on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bogle 2019 Sparkling Rosé (California)

Description: Luscious aromas of tropical fruits, herbs and red berries start this elegant rosé. Its flavors are light and bright, with a clean line of acidity throughout.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Mylonas 2019 Rosé (Attica)

Description: With a ripe blend of Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca, this is a full wine, now soft and open, with a warm red-fruit character. Acidity comes through at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Real Companhia Velha 2019 Síbio Rosé (Douro)

Description: Although pale brassy pink in color, this full-bodied wine offers substantial flavors beyond simply freshness. Its peach, apricot and plum notes are accented by light earthy, toasty flavors, apparently from long aging in the winery cellar, that add complexity and interest.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bee Hunter 2015 Docker Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (Mendocino)

Description: Made from Sonoma County-grown Pinot Noir in a Colorado-based winery, this pink wine is light, crisp and simple, the palate texture steely and metallic. Flavors range from orange and grapefruit to wild strawberry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Steamboat Winery 2019 Ranch Dog Rosé (America)

Description: Sweet berry aromas are followed by flavors of strawberry and pink grapefruit in this likable rosé. Pert and pretty, this is a great patio wine for the summer.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Skouras 2019 Peplo Rosé (Peloponnese)

Description: Dusty, yeasty aromas show notes of orange peel and cantaloupe. This feels round and pleasant, with a bolt of helpful acidity. Slightly salty and bitter flavors of orange and nectarine carry over to a mostly fresh finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2020 Made With Organic Grapes Rosé (Tupungato)

Description: Pretty strawberry and mineral aromas lead into zesty flavors of citrus peel, herbs and fresh red fruits. Assertive and approachable, with a clean, mineral finish.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: La Tour Melas 2019 Idylle d'Achinos Rosé (Greece)

Description: This light, fruity and fresh rosé is easy to sip and enjoy, offering plenty of strawberry and raspberry flavors and fun floral accents. It's nicely dry and well balanced.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Pomelo 2019 Rosé (California)

Description: A tan color is backed by aromas of cantaloupe and petrol. This light-bodied rosé is crisp in feel and superficial, not deep. Dried apricot and underripe melon flavors sway toward bitter prior to an easy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ramón Bilbao 2019 Rosado (Rioja)

Description: With its light prickle on the tongue, this off-dry rosé is fresh and fruity. There is an attractive red-berry fruitiness that is touched by baked apple at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Broadbent NV Rosé (Vinho Verde)

Description: The wine offers aromas of forest berries, vanilla and spice, followed by straightforward strawberry and spice flavors. Velvety and smooth, as well as easy-drinking. Perfect for the patio.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Tsantali 2019 Kanenas Mavroudi-Syrah Rosé (Greece)

Description: Light aromas of orange peel, crushed vitamins and tomato leaf set up a palate that's fleshy on the surface but hollow down below. Salty flavors of red apple skins and peach pit fade away quickly on a mild finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Doña Paula 2020 Early Harvest Rosé (Mendoza)

Description: Nutty and somewhat metallic on the palate, this is a hearty and full-bodied wine, with a taste of legume, earth and strawberry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Grand Napa 2019 The Big Pink Rosé (Napa Valley)

Description: Bland but clean stone fruit aromas are basic, while this feels narrow and tight. Salty cantaloupe and generic nectarine and peach flavors become lightly oxidized on a slightly bitter finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Luzón 2019 Colección Monastrell Rosado (Jumilla)

Description: Sizzling fresh in earthy grapefruit and strawberry, this medium-bodied wine becomes flat on the midpalate with a touch of metal and dried herb.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Calculated Risk 2019 Rosé (Napa Valley)

Description: This rosé of Merlot is translucent red in color, with candied red fruit and red apple flavors offset by notes of lettuce and grass. A weighty palate deals slightly bitter and dull strawberry and raspberry flavors, and a sucking candy sweetness comes up on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Otazu 2019 Merlot Rosado (Navarra)

Description: A neutral nose is the opening act to a bland, obtuse palate. Bitter grape-skin flavors are backed by hints of cantaloupe and peach. This is competently fresh but lacks character and depth on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Campo Viejo 2019 Crisp & Elegant Rosé (Spain)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Melon and peach aromas are mild, while this offers a pop of citrusy acidity on an otherwise bland palate. Flavors of orange, nectarine and cantaloupe are shy, while this falls flat on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Radio Boka 2019 Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: A red color and yeasty aromas of sourdough bread open this Petit Verdot rosé. A lazy palate is medium in weight and short on kick and zest. Flavors of red apple skins and cherry struggle to make a mark on a sleepy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Pago del Vicario 2019 Rubi Edition Petit Verdot Rosada (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Notes of melon, pumpkin and citrus peel comprise a wan nose, while this feels chunky and creamy on a palate that's low on spunk. Stalky, yeasty flavors are nondescript, while this hints at cantaloupe on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Signature Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled
Name: Zolo 2020 Signature Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Rosé (Mendoza)

Description: Gritty aromas are more acrid than fresh and fruity, while the palate on this rosé is mildly citric at first then flat. Generic nectarine and orange juice flavors lose clarity as early onset oxidized notes settle in on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Rutini 2019 Destino Insight Rosé (Mendoza)

Description: Racy and refreshing, this savory, lightly sparkling wine has aromas of wet stone, sea brine, pressed wild flower and a yeasty whiff of bread dough. Made entirely with Frappato and bottled on its lees, the chiseled, bone-dry palate delivers orange zest, juicy sour cherry and alpine herb lifted by an energizing mineral vein of saline. Crisp acidity keeps lively and adds to the tension.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paolo Calì 2018 Mood Metodo Ancestrale Spumante Frappato Rosato (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This natural wine, made with no added sulfites, is a blend of skin-fermented Pinot Gris and Pinot Noir. The color is somewhere tangerine and pink grapefruit. It's remarkably clean and stable for being entirely sulfur-free. A heady perfume of orange peel, honey, baking spices, minerals and flowers leads to a slippery-textured palate that crunches with acidity and pulses with raw, vibrant energy. There's a skinsy bite, like marmalade, on the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Halcyon Days 2019 Gris-Noir Rosé (Hawke's Bay)

Description: A selection from vineyards at the estate, this wine is structured as well as rich in red currant fruits. It has weight and density, ripe acidity and fruitiness. The acidity at the end keeps the wine's freshness very much in the balance. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Gordonne 2019 La Chapelle Gordonne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Description: Bright and inviting, this opens with aromas of Spanish broom, red berry and Mediterranean scrub. On the savory palate, tangy acidity accompanies sour cherry, wild strawberry, white pepper and a saline note before a crisp, clean finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Amuri di Dimmina e Amuri di Matri
Name: Al-Cantàra 2019 Amuri di Dimmina e Amuri di Matri Rosato (Etna)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Light raspberry and rich melon flavors combine nicely in this medium-bodied, concentrated and fresh-tasting wine. Made from Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre, it has plenty of crisp acidity to balance the vivid fruit flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tamber Bey 2019 Fore Family Vineyard Rosé (Red Hills)

Description: The palest of rosés, this wood-aged mature wine is ripe with soft flavors, acidity and just a hint of tannin. It is a real food wine, spicy and with a surprising freshness with tangy orange zest and touches of red fruits. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Martinette 2017 Reflets d'Argens Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Description: Bright and savory, this vibrant rosato has inviting aromas of forest berry, violet and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. The tangy palate offers juicy strawberry, red cherry, white peach and hints of white pepper alongside crisp acidity that leaves a clean finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Fonti a San Giorgio 2019 Rosato (Toscana)

Description: Pinot Meunier is rarely seen in New Zealand, especially on its own, but it works brilliantly for rosé. It's bright and fruity, bouncing with strawberry, watermelon and a stalky, white spice note. There's oodles of acidity on the palate and ripe, fleshy red berries. It's a refreshing little number, with tingly fruit right to the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Middle-Earth 2020 Pinot Meunier Rosé (Nelson)

Description: Made with organically farmed Sangiovese and following strict rules of organic winemaking, this has delicate aromas of red fruit, grilled herb and yeasty whiffs of bread dough. On the bright, savory palate, tangy acidity accompanies strawberry compote, red cherry, orange zest and mineral notes before a white pepper finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Salcheto 2019 Obvius Rosato (Toscana)

Description: With richness and caramel flavors to go with the red berry fruitiness, this is a full wine. It is light on the acidity but full on the ripe fruits. The Grenache gives a typical pepper touch at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Gordonne 2019 Vérité du Terroir Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Description: A pale orange color and clean aromas of orange peel and citrus blossom lead to a pure palate with good balance and snap. A common mix of citrus and mineral-driven flavors turns slightly bitter on a juicy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Baron De Ley 2019 Rosada (Rioja)

Description: A pretty shade of sunset orange in the glass, this rosato made from Negroamaro and Malvasia offers bold aromas of cherry and raspberry on the nose. It's rounded and juicy on the palate, displaying bouncy berry fruit tones lifted by a citrus perfume accent.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vetrère 2019 Taranta Rosato (Salento)

Description: Full of red fruits and attractive acidity, this is a bright rosé. Its freshness is palpable, crisp and crunchy. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Romy 2019 Imperial Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: Aromas of yeast, vanilla and peach precede a juicy palate with punchy acidity. A citrusy flavor profile settles on tangerine, while this feels edgy and fresh on a standard finish with lasting citric acidity.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Muga 2019 Rosado (Rioja)

Description: Soft and fruity, this is a well-balanced wine. Acidity and red-currant freshness partner with the light texture and tangy lemon-zest crispness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Christophe Coquard 2019 Cuvée 69 Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Appellation: Santa Cruz County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded aromas of strawberry, wet clay and orange peel show on the nose of this bottling. There's a taut-enough texture to the palate, where tastes of grapefruit peel, light red currant and ashy earth flavors converge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Integrity 2019 Basor Terrace Vineyard Rosé (Santa Cruz County)

Description: A hint of pepper among the attractive red-fruit flavors gives this wine added complexity and texture. The wine is packed with fruitiness, with an immediately appealing rounded character. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Thivin 2019 Rosé (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: A fruity and ripe wine, this is a delightful cool sip. Acidity and red-currant flavors give a refreshing tang that is the final lift. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Anthony Perol 2019 Pierres Dorées Bojo Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: Syrah, Grenache and Cabernet Sauvignon come together in a crisp, brightly textured and intensely fruity wine. Red currant flavors dominate, giving the wine a fine crisp character. It is ready to drink. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Masques 2019 Essentielle Rosé (Mediterranée)

Description: Young vines have given this vibrant rosé bright red fruits and lively acidity. The wine is crisp with a fresh aftertaste. Drink now. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaines Dominique Piron 2019 Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: Aromas of French oak, grilled herb and camphor carry over to the rather lean palate along with grapefruit, coconut, vanilla and coffee bean. Bright acidity and dusty tannins provide the taut framework.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Pancrazi 2019 Villa di Bagnolo Rosé (Toscana)

Description: Nervy and lean, this raspberry and cherry scented wine shows great acidity, a very tangy texture and low alcohol. It's refreshing and light.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Marietta Cellars 2019 OVR Old Vine Rosé (California)

Description: A fruity and ripe wine, this is a delightful cool sip. Acidity and red-currant flavors give a refreshing tang that is the final lift. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Anthony Perol 2019 Pierres Dorées Bojo Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: A soft and ripe wine with its acidity and freshness now restrained by some bottle age. This is fruity, an attractive red fruit-flavored wine, soft at the end with touches of pepper. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2019 Rose Gold Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
Winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

Description: Sunset orange in the glass, this Gaglioppo rosato is reserved on the nose in aromas of cranberry and Mandarin. It's more energetic on the palate, delivering flavors of crushed stone, small red berries and underripe melon. Fuzzy tannins lend a pleasing grip to it all.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: I Greco 2018 Savù Gaglioppo Rosato (Calabria)

Description: Softly textured and with plenty of red-fruit flavors, this ripe wine has just a bite of pepper at the end. Light acidity gives enough freshness to balance the warmth of the fruits. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Cave du Château des Loges 2019 Premier Bain Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: This attractive, fruity blend of Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz brings out crisp red fruits with acidity and a clean, perfumed aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta de Chocapalha 2019 Mar de Palha Rosé (Lisboa)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is effusively fruity in flavor and lively in texture. Strawberry and red cherry pop out in the aroma, and take on a candied fruit quality on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2019 Bella Rosé (Amador County)

Description: From 60-year-old vines, this ripe and densely textured rosé offers a medley of red fruits. Acidity balances the wine's fragrant fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Fabien Collonge 2019 Rosé de Gamay Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: Delicate watermelon and raspberry flavors light up this pale-colored, medium-bodied wine made from Malbec grapes, that's resting on a smooth and rather palate-coating texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Saracina 2019 Skid Rosé Rosé (Mendocino)

Description: This Hawkes Bay rosé is a blend of Sangiovese, Pinot Noir and Merlot. There's a slightly odd watermelon rind note on the nose, and some yeasty notes, like lees at the bottom of a tank, but also a good lick of red fruit. The palate is dry and textured, with fleshy fruit and a lovely pithy bite.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Te Awanga 2019 Wildsong Wildflower Vineyard Rosé (Hawke's Bay)

Description: This wine is rich, with touches of pepper as well as ripe red fruits. Acidity brings a light touch to this rounded wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Terres Vivantes 2019 Terres Vivantes Rosé (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This softly textured rosé has a caramel edge and ripe strawberry flavors. Its fruitiness and gentle aftertaste are delicious. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Dupeuble Père et Fils 2019 Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: Quiet aromas of blackberry and strawberry start off this Aglianico rosato. Tangy dark berry flavors are lifted by scrubby herbs on the medium-bodied palate, with crushed stone lifting it all up. It ends a bit astringent on the finish, but this is an overall pleasing expression of a bold rosato.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantine del Notaio 2017 Il Rogito Rosato (Basilicata)

Description: This soft, red-fruit-flavored rosé has hints of pepper and spice and lots of fruity acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Javernand 2019 de Gamay Rosé (Beaujolais-Villages)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Quite dark in color, the aromas bring notes of lemongrass, watermelon and cherry. Medium bodied, just off-dry kiwi and Jolly Rancher (cherry and watermelon) flavors follow. The color is a bit off-putting but the aromas and flavors deliver plenty of enjoyment.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lone Birch 2019 Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Description: This is a light and poised rosé. It is attractive and fresh, with a crisp streak of red-currant fruits and a bright aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Paillardière 2019 Cuvée JR Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: A blend of 80% Merlot and 20% Syrah, this straightforward wine has delicate aromas suggesting red berry, eucalyptus and a whiff of field flower. On the tangy palate, bright acidity accompanies sour cherry and a hint of bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Monteti 2019 TM Rosato (Toscana)

Description: This attractively fruity wine, fresh with crushed raspberry flavors, is totally ready to drink. With a candied edge and ripe acidity, the wine is softly textured and bright at the end.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Prébende 2019 Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: From fruit grown in southern Beaujolais, this rich and creamy-textured wine is soft, with a touch of pepper and a finish of ripe acidity. Crushed strawberries come through at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaines Chermette 2019 Griottes Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: Peach and cantaloupe aromas are a touch gritty, while this is lively and zesty due to punchy citric acidity. Yeasty notes blend with citrus skin flavors in front of a dry but slightly bitter finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Beronia 2019 Rosé (Rioja)

Description: This crisp and low-key wine emphasizes a refreshing texture and good acidity, supporting mild cherry flavors. It's nicely balanced and will be versatile in food pairings.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bogle 2019 Rosé (California)

Description: This light-bodied wine offers delicate watermelon flavors and a rather soft, easy-going texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Klinker Brick 2019 Rosé (Lodi)

Description: A cloudy red color and aromas of fennel, red licorice candy and currant are backed by a pinched, lightly concentrated palate. Slightly sweet and green flavors of plum skins and red currant wind down on a raw finish that tastes vaguely of onion.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Gómez de Segura 2019 Tempranillo Rosado (Rioja)

Description: This pale rose-hued wine is a straightforward drop. The nose is on the flat side but offers ripe, somewhat confected fruit notes resembling strawberry and watermelon candy. The palate is dry and slippery. The acidity feels a bit underripe and biting, but there's juicy red fruit through to the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Cottesbrook 2019 Rosé (New Zealand)

Description: Aromas of spring blossom and red berry form the nose of this breezy rosato. Simple but well made, the refreshing, light-bodied palate offers pomegranate and sour cherry alongs side crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fondo Antico 2019 Aprile Rosato (Sicilia)

Description: Soft and rounded, this open wine has a spicy character along with strawberry fruitiness. Drink this smoothly textured wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Laurent Gauthier 2019 Rosé (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This vintage is still very young and reductive, needing time for the oniony notes to settle. Fleshy, ripe strawberry and cherry fruit peep through the cracks. The palate is similarly disjointed with biting acidity, yet lovely fruit rides under the surface.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Mt. Beautiful 2020 Rosé (North Canterbury)

Description: With Malbec from the Dordogne valley, this rosé is crisply fresh. Red currants and a light texture come together in a bright, fruity wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2019 Cuvée Origine 1749 Rosé (Périgord)

Description: The color of this cool, crisp wine is almost Provencal in its lightness. On the palate, touches of pepper bring out the fresh red-currant flavors. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Pizay 2019 Rosé de Soirée Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: This rich rosé highlights red-berry fruitiness, peppered raspberries and light acidity. It is full, ripe and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Penlois 2019 Rosé (Beaujolais-Villages)

Description: This brightly fruity wine has crisp red-currant flavors with a tangy touch. A hint of caramel softens the fruit. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignerons de Bel Air 2019 Le Rosé de Bel Air Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

Description: This effusive, fruity wine exudes candied cherry and strawberry aromas followed by buttery, seemingly sweet flavors on a smooth texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Zoom Juice 2018 Social Rosé (California)

Description: A blend of Merlot and the two Cabernets, this simple wine offers caramel and strawberry flavors. Freshness and a light texture and make it attractive now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2019 Léo by Léo Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This light-bodied, natural-style wine is tart and spritzy in texture, and sports very crisp cranberry and lemon flavors, finishing with a dry, flinty bite.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tessier Winery 2019 Femme Fatale Rosé (El Dorado)

Description: The wine, with its ripe blend of Syrah and Castelâo, is fat with a soft texture and the lightest acidity. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Caves Velhas 2019 Cabeça de Toiro Rosé (Tejo)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A perennially memorable wine, this combines 50% Syrah with 27% Mourvèdre, 20% Grenache and 3% Grenache Blanc. Crisp, meaty and sublime on the palate, it offers bold, layered flavors of wild strawberry, blood orange and vanilla bean.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Limerick Lane 2019 Rosé (Russian River Valley)

Description: Bright and savory, this lightly hued, delicious rosato has delicate aromas of spring blossom, stone fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean brush. Made with 90% Nerello Mascalese and 10% Carricante, the tangy palate offers white peach, blood orange and pink grapefruit alongside crisp acidity. Savory saline notes lift the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone di Villagrande 2019 Rosato (Etna)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a serious, savory and well-structured rose blended from Rhône varietals, and is meant for drinking in place of the usual red wine. A full body and bracing acidity back up interesting plum, rhubarb and melon flavors that are concentrated enough for a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terre Rouge 2019 Vin Gris d'Amador Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A light shade of pink, this bottling begins with delicate aromas of bubblegum, rose and wet stone. The palate comes alive with zesty acidity and a chalky texture, offering flavors of peach, citrus and strawberry.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dovecote 2019 Thompson Vineyard Estate Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Made entirely from Syrah and fermented and aged in both neutral oak and stainless steel, this is dark cranberry in color. Strong, concentrated flavors of cherry, cassis and orange make for a juicy palate of length and grip.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Salvestrin 2019 Vin Rosé (St. Helena)

Description: A blend of three vintages (2015, 2016, 2017) of amphora-aged Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo blended and bottled in July 2018, this wine is rich in color and boasts a cozy nose of wild cherries, softened leather and clay. The palate is vibrant and integrated in defined tones of red cherry and blackberry, with a delicate interplay between lifted acidity and a grip of tannins. There's a pleasing fruit-skin and earthy mineral grip to it all, giving this pink wine a wild edge.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Francesco Cirelli NV Amphora 15+16+17 Organic Rosato (Italy)

Description: Made entirely from Gaglioppo, this rosato starts off with an engaging nose of red currant, Mediterranean scrub and watermelon rind. There's a pleasing, rounded feel to the palate, boasting juicy red-berry flavors struck against a dash of blood-orange rind. Lifted acidity and gentle fruit-skin tannins provide the framing for this food-friendly rosato.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Librandi 2019 Segno Rosato (Cirò)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine comes in a game-changing package, a 500 ml aluminum screwcap bottle that's both refillable and recyclable. The brainchild of Jake Bilbro of Limerick Lane, the wine delivers plenty of bang for the buck as well—as it's a smooth, lovely and crisp celebration of appellated 50% Syrah, 27% Mourvèdre, 20% Grenache and 3% Grenache Blanc that evokes a day of picking fresh berries.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Revelshine 2019 Rosé (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A dark shade of pink in the glass, this ripe style of rosé begins with aromas of strawberry pie and orange cream on the inviting nose. There's a bright sizzle of acidity on the sip, where more of those strawberry and orange flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Crū 2019 Jose's Rosé (Central Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Light-pink in color, this is a nutty, dry and resplendent wine, light, bright and delicately crafted. Layers of citrus, rose petal and wild strawberry mingle with ease.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Paradise Ridge 2019 Bride's Blush Rosé (Russian River Valley)

Description: Brisk aromas of cantaloupe, grapefruit and red-apple peel make for a crisp, enticing entry to this rosato. There's nice roundness and weight to the palate, with flavors of melon and citrus accented by peppery spice. A gentle grip of tannins matches the fruit intensity well, making this a well-balanced, textured offering.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: Tenute Eméra La Vigne en Rose Negroamaro
Name: Claudio Quarta 2019 Tenute Eméra La Vigne en Rose Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)

Description: This is made from 51% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Zinfandel, 10% Merlot and 6% Cabernet Franc. Reductive, the oak is nutty and the palate soft and supple. Strawberry, cherry and Meyer lemon accent a balanced richness lifted by crisp, lasting acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Grgich Hills 2019 Estate Grown Rosé (Napa Valley)

Description: Brisk aromas of cantaloupe, grapefruit and red-apple peel make for a crisp, enticing entry to this rosato. There's nice roundness and weight to the palate, with flavors of melon and citrus accented by peppery spice. A gentle grip of tannins matches the fruit intensity well, making this a well-balanced, textured offering.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: Tenute Eméra La Vigne en Rose Negroamaro
Name: Claudio Quarta 2019 Tenute Eméra La Vigne en Rose Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)

Description: Red berry, blue flower and a whiff of baking spice form the delicate nose on this refreshing rosato. Made with Nebbiolo, the savory, racy palate offers juicy strawberry, orange-slice and white-pepper notes.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ioppa 2019 Rusin Rosato (Colline Novaresi)

Description: A savory, earthy aroma blends into juicy peach and delicate spice flavors in this layered, complex and distinctive wine. Made from Chenin Blanc grapes and a dash of Syrah, it is medium to full bodied and mouthfilling in texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rotation Vineyards 2019 Rosé (Lodi)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rose petals and watermelon are strong while pleasant on the nose of this bottling. The palate is more dynamic, from zesty lemon peel to riper peach-oil flavors, all wrapped in decent tension.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: SeatPocket 2019 Rosé (Central Coast)

Description: Aromas of balsamic-dipped cherry, freshly cut thyme and blood orange carry a slightly wild quality about them. The palate is rounded and smooth in a rich red-cherry flavor that's held in check by a tangy limestone accent. The tannins offer a gentle grip, but are polished in nature, making this a textural beauty to enjoy in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cirelli la Collina Biologica NV Organic Rosato (Italy)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A yellow shade of pink, this 50% Syrah and 50% Mourvèdre rosé begins with aromas of baked cherry, brioche, vanilla and the lightest hint of smoke. There is brisk acidity and textural tension to the sip, where the light smoke tone meets with more cherry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hideaway 2019 S&M Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This Aglianico rosato boasts bright aromas of lychee, papaya and orange blossom. It's juicy and fruity on the palate, showing a mix of tangy and ripe tropical-fruit tones that manage to be held in check by a zesty line of orange-laden acidity. It's a bold, forward style that many will enjoy as an aperitivo.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantina di Venosa 2019 Verbo Rosato (Basilicata)

Description: A blend of Primitivo and Susumaniello, this rosato is crisp in tones of blood orange, cranberry and watermelon. The easygoing fruit flavors are held in check by a slick of wet stone and zesty, bright acidity. A gentle hug of tannins gives grip to the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantine Menhir 2019 Pietra Rosato (Salento)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Grenache (47%) and Mourvèdre (45%) make up most of this wine, with the rest Cinsault. Pale-salmon colored edging slightly darker, the aromas bring notes of satsuma, cherry and watermelon. The palate is full bodied, seeming quite ponderous. There's nice acid, but the wine still gets weighted down.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: DeLille 2019 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Melon and prosciutto flavors mingle nicely in this full-bodied but nicely tangy wine. It has a traditional salmon color, plentiful aromas and mouthfilling peach and melon notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Michael Pozzan 2019 Giapoza Rosé (California)

Description: A blend of white Alvarinho and red Sousão, this is an intriguing wine. Its freshness and citrus character comes from the white grape, while the Sousão gives the color and texture. Together, they make a deliciously bright and fruity wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quintas de Melgaço 2019 QM Rosé (Minho)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: An attractive fruity wine with a bite of pepper, this is poised between soft and crisp. Its bright acidity and raspberry fruitiness are just right. It's ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrézette 2019 Roseberry Malbec Rosé (Côtes du Lot)

Description: A ripe, strawberry and fresh fruit flavored wine, this is attractively ripe and balanced. The wine is warm, full bodied and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Fontes da Cunha 2019 Quinta do Mondego Rosé (Dão)

Description: Made from Gaglioppo, this rosé offers tense tones of tangy red berries filled out by creamy melon and a dash of crushed herbs. It's light bodied in style, showing a pleasing grip of berry skins lifted by a salty, savory undercurrent.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Ippolito 1845 2019 Mabilia Rosé (Cirò)

Description: Wood-aged for six months, this softly textured wine balances ripe red fruits with a boost of acidity. The wine is attractively fruity, lightly spicy and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Monte da Ravasqueira 2018 Ravasqueira Premium Rosé (Alentejano)

Description: Spicy, brambly aromas of currant and raspberry meld with a hints of crushed herbs and blood orange on the nose. The light-bodied palate echoes the aromas, with a salty, savory note creeping in on the finish to lift it all up.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Taverna 2019 Maddalena Primitivo Rosato (Basilicata)

Description: A blend of Merlot and Cabernet Franc from the coastal Landes region, this is a rounded, red fruit ripe wine. With a hint of caramel to point up the acidity and the zesty texture, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2019 La Dune Domaine de Bachen Rosé (Landes)

Description: A rosé from the Négrette grape of Fronton, this is lightly textured with spice and peppered raspberry flavors. With its ripeness and texture, it is probably best as a food rosé. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2019 Pyréne Le Temps des Roses Rosé (Comté Tolosan)

Description: A ripe, rounded and balanced wine, this has red-berry fruits and a fine freshness. Crisp while also full of generous fruitiness, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta da Lapa 2019 Nana Rosé (Tejo)

Description: An earthy, smoky aroma leads to fruity, fresh flavors and medium body in this light and tangy wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2019 River Ranch Vineyard Aglianico Rosé (Jahant)

Description: Aged for three months in wood, this deeply colored rosé has spice and toastiness as much as fruit. It's mature, ripe with hints of red fruits and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta dos Avidagos 2018 Reserva Rosé (Douro)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's just a tinge of color to this wine. Cherry and watermelon aromas lead to broad, slightly fat-feeling flavors that get bogged down.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: H3 2019 Rosé (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: Made from 100% Malbec, this wine has ripeness as well as a rounded texture. Acidity shoots through, bringing with it raspberry flavors and shots of orange zest. Drink this attractive wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lagrézette 2019 Le Rosé de Julie Rosé (Côtes du Lot)

Description: Aromas of pressed raspberry and cranberry meld with a gentle herbal tone on the nose. The red-berry flavors are brisk and bouncy on the palate, with lifted acidity pushing them along to a mild, yeasty finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valle Reale 2018  Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo

Description: Touriga Nacional and Syrah make a soft, fruity wine, just lightly textured. With its fresh fruit, red-currant flavors and crisp acidity, this is an attractive, tangy wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta do Casal Branco 2019 Terra de Lobos Rosé (Tejo)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Rich aromas of strawberry and raspberry meld with a stemmy accent of rooibos on the nose. The palate is rounded in feel, showing a mild vein of ripe red-berry tones that's just balanced by a lifted of acidity. It ends a bit drying and a bit astringent.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Ognissole 2019 Pontelama Nero di Troia Rosato (Castel del Monte)

Description: This light-bodied wine is clean and straightforward. Its aroma is light, and its cherry and raspberry flavors are mild, resting on a soft texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bota Box 2019 Dry Rosé (California)

Description: Red-cherry and sour-cherry flavors light up this medium-bodied wine, adding a nip of good fruit acidity on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Keynote 2019 Rosé (California)

Description: Shy aromas of banana, guava and blood orange carry the delicate nose. The medium-bodied palate boasts tart flavors of melon and citrus, ending brisk on a slightly candied tone.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masciarelli 2019 Rosato (Colline Teatine)

Description: Light bodied, this wine offers tasty watermelon flavors and touches of earth and smoked meat.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Winemakers Selection 2019 Rosé (California)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of wild thyme and sage carry the herbal-driven nose. The palate is more expressive in flavors of tart red cherry and crushed limestone. It shows good lift thanks to vibrant acidity, with a pomegranate-laden finish marking the brisk close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni 2019 Fonte Venna Rosato (Terre di Chieti)
Winery: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni

Description: This is a bright, light and fruity wine that has attractive red-currant and raspberry flavors. This is crisp, piled with acidity as well as fruitiness. Drink now. Suitable for vegans. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Casca Wines 2019 1808 Colheita Rosé (Beira Interior)

Description: Good cherry and raspberry flavors carry a bit of sweetness in this medium-bodied, straightforward wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bucket List NV Rosé (California)

Description: Simple cherry and strawberry flavors compete for attention with a dried herb accent in this dry, light-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ultraviolet NV Sparkling Rosé (California)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A smoky, flinty streak dominates the flavors of this medium- to full-bodied wine. Its freshly cut wood and black-pepper notes don't leave much room for fruitiness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Vina Moda 2019 Sierra Rose Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

Description: The wine is crisp, clean and fruity, with red currant freshness. It does have considerable acidity that is almost shockingly intense. Maybe by 2021 this will have softened.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta da Lapa 2019 Selection Rosé Rosé (Tejo)

Description: Crisp and ripe, this is a simple, fruity wine, with red-currant and raspberry flavors. Plenty of tangy acidity gives it a lift at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Adega de Borba 2019 Premium Rosé (Alentejo)

Description: This soft, rounded wine has touches of caramel to give extra richness to the strawberry flavors. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Casca Wines 2019 Cabo da Roca Rosé (Lisboa)

Description: Tasty raspberry and watermelon flavors in this full-bodied wine are coated in rather heavy baking spices and vanilla.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey NV Organic Rosé (Mendocino)

Description: A strawberry-candy flavored wine, this has shockingly bright acidity and a vibrant feel. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta dos Avidagos 2019 Avidagos Colheita Rosé (Douro)

Description: Made with organically farmed Nerello Mascalese, this radiant rosato offers delicate, enticing scents of Spanish broom, Mediterranean brush, beeswax and ripe orchard fruit. Grown in high-vineyard altitudes and from old vines planted at the end of the 1800s—most of them ungrafted—the racy, savory palate has personality and a depth of flavors including pomegranate, sour cherry and salty mineral notes that sneak up on you.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenute Bosco 2018 Piano dei Daini Rosato (Etna)

Description: Made with organically grown Nerello Mascalese (90%) and Nerello Cappuccio (10%), this delicious, quenching rosato offers inviting aromas suggesting rose petal, Mediterranean scrub, wild berry and eucalyptus. The mouthwatering palate doles out juicy red cherry, crushed pomegranate seed and white pepper alongside energizing acidity. It closes on a saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Terra Costantino 2019 De Aetna Rosato (Etna)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This outstanding rosé packs a punch, with a riot of strawberries bursting forth. The core fruit flavors include sweet cherry and the fresh acidity makes it an excellent palate-cleanser. It's simply delicious and best enjoyed over the next year.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Westmount 2019 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Description: Tangy and crisp, this racy rosato has aromas of dark-skinned berry, wet stone and a whiff of forest floor. The bright savory palate delivers juicy red cherry, raspberry, orange zest and salty mineral notes alongside vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Calabretta 2019 Rosato (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Wild strawberry and crisp raspberry notes mingle into shades of smoke and sunbaked earth in this dry rosé. Made from Pinot Noir sourced from loess and volcanic soils, it's a distinctly smoky, seductive bottling balanced by a fresh, citrusy undertone. Best enjoyed young but it's a rosé that's substantial enough to drink well through this fall and winter.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Franz Keller 2019 vom Löss Rosé (Baden)

Description: White spring wild flower, red berry and Mediterranean scrub form the delicate nose along with a whiff of yellow stone fruit. On the bright elegant palate, vibrant acidity offsets juicy pomegranate, sour cherry and white pepper before a savory, saline finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Massimo Lentsch 2019 OMA Rosato (Etna)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A pale shade of yellowish pink in the glass, this tightly wound bottle shows light melon and lemon zest on the brisk nose. The palate is crisp and delightful in flavors of melon, peach and a hint of coconut oil. It's altogether fresh and engaging.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Daou 2019 Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: Zesty red cherry and watermelon abound in this exceptionally spry Mosel rosé. Made from Pinot Noir, it's a dry, intensely thirst-quenching sip that finishes on a salty mineral fringe. A racy, refreshing rosé that should drink well year round.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2018 RK Pinot Noir Rosé (Mosel)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is made from 90% Pinot Noir and 10% Carignan, the grapes both bled and direct-pressed to make the wine. Light, crisp and meaty on the palate, it is weighty yet balanced, a celebration of cranberry, strawberry and rhubarb flavors.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pellegrini 2019 Rosé (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe orange, plum flesh and raspberry aromas are cut by a Mandarin-pith element on the nose of this bottling. Juicy peach and strawberry flavors come through on the sip, where the acidity is fresh.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wolff 2019 Rosé (Central Coast)

Description: With a very appealing pale copper color, this wine boasts reserved aromas of strawberry and citrus followed by fuller feeling flavors but with more than ample acidity to keep the interest high.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Colter's Creek 2019 Negroamaro Rosé (Lewis-Clark Valley (ID))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of watermelon and ocean spray meet with crumpled lavender and red flowers on the nose of this bottling. Stony flavors show on the palate, where wet cement, plum and ash elements make for a compelling sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Broken Earth 2019 Limited Release Grenache Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: Blending 85% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot, this is a hearty rendering of saignée wine taken from the tank on the first day of harvest and fermented in stainless steel. It opens in a sweetness of peach and raspberry, dark in color and thickly rich in style.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Somnium 2019 Rosé (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
