Description: This is all Grenache. The aromas are bright and appealing, with notes of watermelon and strawberry. A juicy, richly flavorful, medium-bodied palate follows. It's a bit weighty at times but still has the acidity to pull it off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Jaine 2019 Sustainable Vineyards Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This blends 90% Pinot Noir with 10% Grenache, the wine spending five months in neutral barrels. Dry with insistent acidity, it offers delicate layers of lemon peel, lime and grapefruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ram's Gate 2019 Rosé (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All the fruit for this rosé of Syrah comes from Gamache Vineyard. It's a pretty pale peach color, with aromas of herb and citrus zest providing appeal. The palate is tart and focused, with a zip of acidity.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Succession 2019 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented entirely in stainless, this zesty rosé has more grapefruit than berry flavors, firmly supported with brisk acidity. The finish resonates with a palate-refreshing minerality.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2019 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Description: A dry, textured wine with layers of acidity, this tastes of cranberry and currant, with thick underlying tannin. Cabernet Sauvignon contributes the majority of the flavor, followed by Malbec, Merlot and Cabernet Franc, all providing subtle power and a finishing touch of dried herb.                      Virginie Boone
Name: St. Supéry 2019 Rosé (Napa Valley)

Description: Aromas of spring blossom, citrus and Mediterranean brush form the nose. On the tangy palate, bright acidity accompanies juicy red cherry, pomegranate and saline notes.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Firriato 2019 Le Sabbie dell'Etna Rosato (Etna)

Description: Dark Beaujolais Gamay in color, this heavy and rich wine is made from 52% Tempranillo and 48% Syrah, some of the grapes sourced from Stagecoach Vineyard. Aged in neutral oak, it offers robust tannin and pronounced flavors of cranberry, currant and plum.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Patland 2018 Lilla in Fiore Rosé (Napa Valley)

Description: Dark Beaujolais Gamay in color, this heavy and rich wine is made from 52% Tempranillo and 48% Syrah, some of the grapes sourced from Stagecoach Vineyard. Aged in neutral oak, it offers robust tannin and pronounced flavors of cranberry, currant and plum.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Patland 2018 Lilla in Fiore Rosé (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of wet cement, rose petal and light plum show on the nose of this bottling. There is just enough tension on the palate, where plum-flesh and watermelon-rind flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: SIX26 2019 Rosé (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A very pretty pale salmon color, this wine offers aromas of watermelon, herbs, crushed dried rose petal and yellow strawberry. A strong sense of acidity enlivens the palate. The dried rose aromas get in the way at times.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kind Stranger 2019 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from Grenache and Syrah, this wine has inviting aromas of strawberry cream, cherry and lime, its texture taking on a grip of lemon pith and apricot. Tangy acidity gives it plenty of lift and breadth, finishing bright and racy.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Paradise Ridge 2019 Pretty in Pink Rosé (Russian River Valley)

Description: A darker shade of pink in the glass, this bottling shows candied strawberry and wet earth on the ripe nose. There's a zip to the sip, where ripe raspberry, ripe plum and even hints of boysenberry arise, with rust and wet stone elements in the background.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wrath 2019 Saignee Rosé (Monterey)

Description: This is made entirely from Grenache grapes, presenting in an austere style of nuanced acidity and fruit. Strawberry, lime and tangy lemon highlight the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kunde 2019 Estate Grown Signature Rosé (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a kitchen sink saignée-style rosé that includes a blend of red and white grapes. Showing a bit of bricking, the aromas are generous, with notes of watermelon, herb and strawberry. The palate is fuller feeling, thick at times, getting bogged down.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Sparkman 2019 This Old Porch Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This rosé blends Riesling, Gewürztraminer, Chardonnay and a splash of Pinot Noir. It's a pretty pink color, light and undistinguished on the palate. From a state with exemplary rosés made from single varieties (notably Pinot Noir and Grenache), this is serviceable but ordinary.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Hyland 2019 Single Vineyard Rosé (McMinnville)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This blended rosé is pink and dry, innocuous to a fault. There's simply no character here; other than the color it's a generic white wine with thin, lemony fruit.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Domaine Loubejac 2019 Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Description: Bright red cherry and watermelon notes are edged by a subtle whiff of smoke in this easy-drinking, straightforward sparkling rosé. It's a bit on the sweeter side and a touch candied in tone, but balanced by fresh acidity and bold effervescence. Enjoy young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schmitt Söhne NV Bubbles Rosé (Germany)

Description: This sunset-hued Moscato rosé is a sweet, low alcohol number that offers a nose of candied watermelon and stewed red berries, along with what feels like a fair whack of sulfur. The palate is syrupy and a little flat, wanting for more acidity and freshness. One for the sweet tooth among us.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Audrey Wilkinson 2018 Winemakers Selection Moscato Rosé (Swan Valley)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this informal wine has aromas of red berry and citrus. Reflecting the nose, the light-bodied palate offers juicy red cherry and orange rind alongside brisk acidity. It's extremely simple but refreshing.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ecolosi 2019 Nero d'Avola Rosé (Sicilia)

Description: Intense aromas of spring wildflowers, wild berries and Mediterranean brush lead the nose on this tangy rosato. Made with organically grown Nerello Mascalese, the vibrant, delicious palate delivers strawberry, pomegranate, star anise and a hint of ginger alongside racy acidity. It closes on a savory saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Montoni 2019 Rose di Adele Rosato (Sicilia)

Description: Deeply hued and downright delicious, this compelling rosato has inviting aromas of ripe berries, citrus, grilled herbs and a briny note of oyster shell. On the savory, quenching palate, tangy acidity lifts juicy raspberry, black cherry and baking spice.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sallier de la Tour 2019 Madamarosé Syrah Rosé (Sicilia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A vibrant shade of fuchsia, this rosé begins with snappy aromas of pomegranate, strawberry, rose petal and wet rocks. The complexity carries through to the sip, where raspberry and red plum flavors ride racy acidity and a compellingly taut structure.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brecon Estate 2019 Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: Bright and savory, this lovely rosato has enticing scents of spring blossom, wild berries, hazelnut and Mediterranean scrub. On the racy palate, vibrant acidity accompanies juicy pomegranate and wild strawberry before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tascante 2019 Tefra Rosato (Etna)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There are big and blossoming aromas on this bottling, including tangerine spray, a hint of cantaloupe and a touch of yeast on the nose. The wine erupts into a sizzling mousse in the glass, where orange and strawberry flavors are wiped clean by persistent acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jarman 2015 Brut Rosé (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pink grapefruit and light strawberry aromas pop on the crisp and fresh nose of this bottling. There is great tension to the sip, where fruity berry flavors mingle with a crushed stone minerality, checking multiple rosé boxes.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hearst Ranch 2019 Julia Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: Made by winemaker Steve Matthiasson from Cabernet Franc grown in both Oak Knoll and Carneros, this wine delights in light-golden-copper color and high-toned acidity. Meaty and herbal, it is layered in lime, Meyer lemon and grapefruit, with a stony minerality.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ashes & Diamonds 2019 No. 4 Rosé (Napa Valley)

Description: A new offering from French-born winemaker Julien Fayard, based in the Napa Valley now, who looks to Provençal techniques to make this wine. Crisp, dry and earthy, it offers herbal elements of grass around racy lemon and lime, finishing in crisp peach and watermelon. It is made from a blend of Grenache, Syrah and Pinot Noir.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Just Pink! 2019 Rosé (California)

Description: This is an elegant, dry wine, offering a copper color, light raspberry aromas, lightly tart flavors and an appetizing, snappy texture. It is great for those who favor balance and crispness in a bottle of fizz.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Louis Pommery NV Brut Rosé (California)

Description: A faint shade of yellowish pink, this rosé blend of 47% Grenache, 32% Carignan, 13% Syrah and 8% Mourvèdre offers plenty of struck stone aromas on the nose along with lemon-peel, pink-lemonade and plum-skin touches. There's great zip to the sip, where light lemon, orange and pluot flavors provide a tangy experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Big Basin 2019 Rosé (California)

Description: This bright, refreshing rosato kicks off with aromas of pink grapefruit, blood orange, watermelon and a heady dose of white flowers on the nose. It's rounded and polished on the palate, displaying ripe melon and orange flavors. Its tangy acidity lends ample lift without feeling sharp. Lingering elements of citrus peels and blossoms mark the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masseria Li Veli 2019 Askos Susumaniello Rosato (Salento)

Description: Tangy and delicious, this bright rosato has delicate scents evoking yellow spring flowers, wild red berries and crushed Mediterranean herbs. The savory, bone-dry palate delivers wild strawberry, juicy sour cherry and citrus before a salty finish. Crisp acidity keeps it balanced.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Graci 2019 Rosato (Etna)

Description: This bright, refreshing rosato kicks off with aromas of pink grapefruit, blood orange, watermelon and a heady dose of white flowers on the nose. It's rounded and polished on the palate, displaying ripe melon and orange flavors. Its tangy acidity lends ample lift without feeling sharp. Lingering elements of citrus peels and blossoms mark the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masseria Li Veli 2019 Askos Susumaniello Rosato (Salento)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This widely available, well-priced bottling is a great warm-weather salve. Aromas of raspberry, wet soil and ash lead into a sizzling palate of ripe plum, watermelon and crushed stone flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ryder Estate 2019 Pinot Noir Rosé (Central Coast)

Description: Red berry, Spanish broom and wet stone aromas waft out of the glass. Made with Nerello Mascalese, this wine has a savory palate that doles out juicy strawberry, pomegranate, blood orange and white pepper before a tangy saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Palmento Costanzo 2019 Mofete Rosato (Etna)

Description: Fresh and delicious, this fun rosato has aromas and flavors of pink grapefruit, wild red berries, Mediterranean scrub and saline. Crisp acidity gives it a dry but tangy close. You'll need more than one bottle of this for sure.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Funaro 2019 Rosato (Sicilia)

Description: This is an attractively balanced wine full of perfumed red currant fruits and crisp acidity. It is fresh and bright, with a tight texture and a refreshing aftertaste. Drink this lightly mineral wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Alban Roblin 2019 Rosé (Sancerre)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A delicate shade of light pink in the glass, this bottling begins with precise and inviting aromas of strawberry and bubblegum. The texture engages the palate, where rosewater flavors lead the floral way across bright acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bernardus 2019 Rosé (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Mourvèdre makes up 40% of this wine, with the rest Cinsault (33%) and Grenache. Pale peach in color, this wine brings aromas of strawberry, whole tangerine and watermelon range. The palate is somewhat weighty in feel but with enough acid to pull it off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Syncline 2019 Rosé (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: This wine, surprisingly rich, has a fine, elegant character. Balanced red fruits, bright acidity and a lively texture. It has all come together in this complex and fresh wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2019 Domaine Petroni Rosé (Corse)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: A blend of 51% Malbec and 49% Syrah, this wine is dark-copper-red in color. Unctuous and thick, with undeniable richness and meaty tannin, it has lasting waves of powerfully intense currant, plum and cranberry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Nellcôte 2018 Bald Mountain Ranch Rosé (Mount Veeder)

Description: The balance between ripe red currant fruits and tight acidity is impeccable in this wine. That gives freshness, richness and a deliciously crisp aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Pascal & Nicolas Reverdy 2019 Terre de Maimbray Rosé (Sancerre)

Description: Packaged in seaside-perfect cans, this sparkling rosé is quite tasty, starting with aromas of melon, strawberry, chalk and rose blossoms. The palate is clean and refreshing, with joyous flavors of raspberry and orange peel.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Beach Juice 2019 Bubbles Sparkling Rosé (California)

Description: Strawberry aromas out front on this pretty pale peach colored wine, followed by notes of wet stone. The palate brings a lot of weight and flavor intensity but with more than enough acidity to pull it off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Rôtie Cellars 2019 85% Mourvèdre 15% Grenache Rosé (Washington)

Description: Packaged in seaside-perfect cans, this sparkling rosé is quite tasty, starting with aromas of melon, strawberry, chalk and rose blossoms. The palate is clean and refreshing, with joyous flavors of raspberry and orange peel.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Beach Juice 2019 Bubbles Sparkling Rosé (California)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Beautiful ballerina-pink in color, this rosato entices on the nose in aromas of lemon zest, grapefruit and strawberry. It's rounded and juicy on the palate, exploding with succulent flavors of red berries and watermelon that are held in check by well-integrated citrus-laden acidity. It's fruity, fun, delicious and well-balanced—everything a Bombino Nero rosato should be.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Rivera 2019 Pungirosa Bombino Nero Rosato (Castel del Monte)

Description: A blend of 85% Primitivo and 15% Aglianico, this richly hued rosato offers a beautiful mix of watermelon, strawberry, crushed stone and blood orange on the nose. It's rounded and juicy on the palate, showing pure berry-fruit tones alongside lifted elements of citrus and spice, all framed in a gentle hug of cranberry-skin tannins.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pietraventosa 2019 EstRosa Rosato (Murgia)

Appellation: Paso Robles Estrella District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A soft shade of pink in the glass, this rosé offers light and inviting aromas of strawberry, melon, lemongrass, wet stone and jasmine on the nose. The texture is extremely chalky, framing ripe flavors of poached plum and strawberry as well as bubblegum.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Hall 2019 Cavern Select Grenache Rosé (Paso Robles Estrella District)

Description: Pale onion-skin-colored in the glass, this Nero di Troia rosato offers a delicate nose of spring blossoms and lemon zest. The palate is tense in tones that echo the aromas, with a more giving melon flavor filling it out. Persistent acidity and tangy crushed stone give a real sense of vitality and length to the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Botromagno 2019 Rosé di Lulú Rosato (Murgia)

Description: Made entirely with Nebbiolo, this offers delicately enticing scents of violet, red berry and a whiff of wild thyme. The vibrant palate delivers juicy sour cherry, strawberry, star anise and a savory, almost salty saline finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Torraccia del Piantavigna 2019 Barlàn Rosato (Colline Novaresi)

Description: The nose of this pink-hued wine is very shy. It is on the palate that its essential lightness and freshness become apparent. This is like a dive into a cool pool, brisk, vivid and enlivening. The body is slender and light, and the finish is dry and lemony.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henners 2018 Native Grace Rosé (England)

Description: Silex, or flint soil, is the base of the vineyards at this domaine. This rosé, made from Pinot Noir, has a mineral edge that balances the red currant fruitiness and perfumed acidity. A touch of caramel confers some richness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Gérard Fiou 2019 Terroir Silex Rosé (Sancerre)

Description: Hazy strawberry in color and closed with a crown cap, this rosato of Montepulciano screams glou glou from the get-go. Rich cherry and strawberry aromas come with a dusting of herbs and crushed stone on the nose. It's tangy and grippy on the palate, but well balanced in its offering of cranberry- and cherry-skin flavors.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valentina Passalacqua NV Mezzarosa Rosato (Puglia)

Description: Red berries, wild herbs and a whiff of hazelnut waft out of the glass. It's bright and savory, offering sour cherry, white peach and grapefruit alongside crisp acidity before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cusumano 2019 Alta Mora Rosato (Etna)

Description: This is a ripe, fruity wine that is both refreshing and full-bodied. The raspberry fruit flavors are rich while also having a crisp, tight line of acidity. Drink this attractive wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Delaporte 2019 Chavignol Rosé (Sancerre)

Description: Made from a blend of grapes, this is light cotton-candy-pink in color, with a tight, textured palate of strawberry and vanilla. The backbone is racy in lime.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Angels & Cowboys 2019 Rosé (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light grapefruit peel and chalk aromas meet with a bit of dried rose petals on the nose of his bottling. There is a decent grip to the sip, where lemon-skin and light nectarine flavors align.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Grassini 2019 Afiora Rosé (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: This is a deliciously ripe, succulent rosé. With a rich feel, it is full-bodied while managing to keep a margin of freshness. A touch of minerality at the end adds a final bite. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Hubert Brochard 2019 Rosé (Sancerre)

Description: This attractive, ripe and fresh-tasting wine balances tangy grapefruit with raspberry and watermelon flavors that are rich and satisfying.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sterling 2018 Vintner's Collection Rosé (California)

Description: A balanced, fruity wine, now ready to drink. Its predominance of Touriga Nacional has given the wine a light structure as well as ripe red currant and strawberry fruits. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Poças 2019 Poças Rosé (Douro)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A slightly yellow shade of pink in the glass, this rosé begins with bubblegum and cotton-candy aromas on the nose, with just a touch of chalk. The palate offers light peach and orange-peel flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dragonette 2019 Rosé (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: A blend of 75% Nebbiolo and 25% Barbera, this is a new wine for one of Barolo's most historic producers. It offers light scents of rose, botanical herb and wild red berry while the dry tangy palate offers sour cherry, cranberry and the barest hint of fennel seed. Crisp acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Oddero 2019 United Vines Rosato (Langhe)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's plenty to chew on on the aromas, with notes of pear, citrus, strawberry and cream. Broad, heavy feeling strawberry flavors. It gets a bit bogged down through the middle, but the acid picks it back up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Canvasback 2019 Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, wild berries and white peach form the inviting nose. The crisp, tangy palate offers sour cherry, citrus and savory saline alongside bright acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Girolamo Russo 2019 Rosato (Etna)

Description: This attention-getting wine made from Pinot Noir, Mourvèdre and Chardonnay is very lively in texture, and offers vivid raspberry and cider flavors. It has good balance and a fine bead of bubbles.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Une Femme NV The Callie Rosé (California)

Description: On the richer side of rosé, this is a ripe wine. The sweet strawberry flavors are balanced by crisp acidity. At the end, there is a bite of pepper and spice. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Sautereau 2019 Rosé (Sancerre)

Description: Made with Nerello Mascalese and Nocera, this delightful rosato has delicate scents of white spring flowers and wild berries together with a whiff of nut. On the refreshing, easygoing palate, tangy acidity accompanies strawberry and a hint of citrus before closing on a hint of almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2019 Rosa Dolce & Gabbana Rosato (Sicilia)

Description: A dry rosé, with violet perfumes and light bite of pepper, this is also packed with fruit. The red currant flavors shine through this pale colored wine, giving a ripe, caramel tinged aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clamens 2019 Julie Rosé (Fronton)

Description: Made with Nerello Mascalese and Nocera, this delightful rosato has delicate scents of white spring flowers and wild berries together with a whiff of nut. On the refreshing, easygoing palate, tangy acidity accompanies strawberry and a hint of citrus before closing on a hint of almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2019 Rosa Dolce & Gabbana Rosato (Sicilia)

Description: This Aglianico-based rosato offers a creamy mix of strawberry and melon flavors, with a delicate accent of spice lifting it up. It shows impeccable balance from a zesty shot of orange-laden acidity, making it a solid value-driven option.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Amastuola 2019 Ondarosa Rosato (Puglia)

Description: This is a softly fruity, light peppery wine, that is ready to drink. With its red fruits, gentle texture and final crisp red currant flavors, the wine is attractive and packed with fruitiness.                      Roger Voss
Name: Aromanes 2019 Eternity Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Description: Made with organically cultivated Nerello Mascalese, this pretty rosato has aromas of Mediterranean herbs and red berries with a whiff of almond. Reflecting the nose, the light-bodied, tangy palate offers pomegranate, blood orange and a hint of hazelnut. It closes on a note of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vivera 2019 di Martinella Rosato (Etna)

Description: The pale skin color of the Pinot Gris gives this attractive rosé a bright character. That goes well with the light spice and pepper flavors that are lightened by red currant fruitiness. Drink the wine now. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Reuilly 2019 Rosé (Reuilly)

Appellation: Côtes du Tarn, Southwest France, France
Description: A meeting between the Atlantic and the Mediterranean, this is a blend of the two Cabernets and Syrah. The wine is soft, fruity and lightly perfumed. Red fruits are underlined with caramel and freshened by the tangy acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine D'en Ségur 2019 Le Rosé (Côtes du Tarn)

Description: Produced, as its name says, from young Pinot Noir vines, the wine is crisp while having plenty of forward, ripe red fruits. Its acidity and freshness give the wine an attractive final lift. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Famille Bourgeois 2019 Les Jeunes Vignes Pinot Noir Rosé (Sancerre)

Description: Ripe Pinot Noir gives a smoothly textured wine that has an attractive shot of red currant freshness. The wine is fruity and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Isabelle et Pierre Clément 2019 Classique Rosé (Menetou-Salon)

Description: A 50-50 blend of Nero d'Avola and Syrah, this delightful rosato has aromas of red berries, Spanish broom and bitter almond. On the crisp, easygoing palate, racy acidity accompanies sour cherry and orange zest before a note of white pepper signals the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2019 Rosé (Sicilia)

Description: Made from Touriga Nacional, the wine is ripe and rounded in texture, with a light touch of tannin. The acidity is easily in balance, just crispening the wine's natural fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta do Vallado 2019 Vallado Rosé (Douro)

Description: A ripe and fruity wine that has plenty of fresh acidity to balance the raspberry fruit flavors. Just a touch of orange zest gives the wine a crisp aftertaste.                      Roger Voss
Name: Alain Girard et Fils 2019 Rosé (Sancerre)

Description: A tangy red-cherry character pervades this nicely appetizing and light-bodied wine. It tastes fresh and the red-fruit flavors are vivid.                      Jim Gordon
Name: AVA Grace 2019 Rosé (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pretty pale peach color, this wine shows some reduction out of the gate that distracts. Behind that are notes of melon and strawberry. An acid driven palate follows. It hasn't all come together at present.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dunham 2019 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: From the large 300-acre estate, this wine, properly pale in color, has attractive freshness and bright acidity. It shows red currant and a light peppery edge, with a fine, perfumed fruitiness and lingering aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2019 Domaine Vetriccie Rosé (Corse)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: Aromas of crushed rock, fresh herbs and strawberry are pretty and lifted on the nose. There's breadth and weight to the palate, showing a mix of tart strawberry and juicy watermelon flavors alongside a heady dose of orange spice. The spice tones linger on the finish, along with a bit of heat.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Produttori di Manduria 2019 Aka Primitivo Rosato (Salento)

Description: This attractive wine shows a crisp while ripe character that is balanced and full of red fruits. There is just a hint of tannic texture to give the wine extra complexity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta de Paços 2019 Casa de Paços Rosé (Vinho Verde)

Description: From one of the pioneers of rosé Vinho Verde, the wine is crisp and fruity, with attractive red berry flavors. There is a bright tang of acidity at the end of this light, refreshing wine.                      Roger Voss
Name: Casa do Valle 2019 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

Description: Attractively poised between freshness and a rich character, this wine is well balanced. Its fruitiness brings out plenty of vibrant acidity as well a tangy, red currant and orange zest flavor. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de l'Ermitage 2019 Cuvée Rosé (Menetou-Salon)

Description: This attractive wine shows a crisp while ripe character that is balanced and full of red fruits. There is just a hint of tannic texture to give the wine extra complexity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta de Paços 2019 Casa de Paços Rosé (Vinho Verde)

Description: From the large 300-acre estate, this wine, properly pale in color, has attractive freshness and bright acidity. It shows red currant and a light peppery edge, with a fine, perfumed fruitiness and lingering aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2019 Domaine Vetriccie Rosé (Corse)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: From one of the pioneers of rosé Vinho Verde, the wine is crisp and fruity, with attractive red berry flavors. There is a bright tang of acidity at the end of this light, refreshing wine.                      Roger Voss
Name: Casa do Valle 2019 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

Description: Whiffs of rose, red berry and Mediterranean scrub form the nose on this racy rosé. Made with organically grown Sangiovese, the tangy palate offers pomegranate, tart cherry and tangerine alongside crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Principe Corsini 2019 Venusio Sangiovese Rosato (Toscana)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A dark shade of pink in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of ripe red plums, dark berry and turned earth on the nose. The palate is clean and crisp, with pleasant flavors of bright berry and a touch of sanguine earthiness.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rabble 2019 Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: So here is a novelty for a Portuguese rosé: a 100% Grenache wine. The grape that is the signature of so many Provence rosés in France lends itself to a deliciously crisp wine with hints of pepper and fresh red fruits. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Rui Reguinga 2019 Quinta Vale Veados Rosé (Tejo)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An almost magenta color in the glass, this rosé blend of 44% Syrah, 30% Grenache and 26% Carignan starts with clean and crisp aromas of raspberry and hibiscus. There's a sizzle of acidity on the sip, where raspberry and cherry flavors meet with a bit of wet stone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Straight Out Of Paso 2019 Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: A light-salmon color and abundant fruit flavors give this medium-bodied wine a very likeable expression and easy drinkability. It tastes fresh and well balanced.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2019 Vintner's Reserve Rosé (California)

Description: Red berry, Spanish broom and Mediterranean brush aromas form the delicate nose. On the tangy palate, bright acidity accompanies wild strawberry and sour cherry before a savory saline finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valenti 2019 Poesia Rosato (Etna)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: This rosé, which is mostly Syrah with 5% Grenache, shows loads of ripe watermelon, rose petals and bubblegum on the nose. There's a subtle tension to the sip, though it fades quickly into the midpalate, where light berry, crisp plum and red-apple flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Byron Blatty 2019 Rosé (Los Angeles County)

Description: Aromas of Mediterranean brush, broom and white stone fruit waft out of the glass. Linear and bright, the racy, delicate palate shows sour cherry, pomegranate and saline notes set against crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Calcaneus 2019 Romice delle Sciare Rosato (Etna)

Appellation: Coteaux du Vendômois, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a soft style of rosé, produced in a small region near the city of Vendôme. With gentle red fruit flavors and a lightly tangy texture, the wine is attractive and perfect as a summer aperitif.                      Roger Voss
Name: Famille Bourgeois 2019 Le Vert Galant Pineau d'Aunis Rosé (Coteaux du Vendômois)

Description: The two grapes (duas castas) in this blend are Touriga Nacional and Syrah. Together they make a fine, ripe wine with a light structure and attractively perfumed red fruits. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Falua 2019 Duas Castas Rosé (Tejo)

Description: Rich and ripe for a rosé, this wine is full bodied, creamy in texture and packed with attractive cherry and cantaloupe flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Layer Cake 2018 Rosé (California)

Description: Aromas of cantaloupe and peach pit are fruity and bitter at the same time. This Malbec-led rosé feels full and slightly grabby, while peppery citrus and peach flavors finish round and balanced.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Maquis 2019 Gran Reserva Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

Description: A smoothly textured wine that has a good balance between freshness and ripe red fruits. Its acidity cuts neatly through the wine, giving a fresh, zingy aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Falua 2019 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Tejo)

Description: This is a rich, full-bodied wine from a single parcel, full of ripe strawberry fruits while light on freshness. With its high alcohol, it is definitely a food wine, rounded while finishing with enough crispness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Sancerre 2019 Rosé (Sancerre)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Darker in color than recent vintages, this is a weighty interpretation of rosé, where the palate gets quite bogged down with heavy fruit flavors. The aromas offer interest but can't make up the difference.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Sleight of Hand 2019 The Magician's Assistant Blackrock Vineyard Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Description: A smoothly textured wine that has a good balance between freshness and ripe red fruits. Its acidity cuts neatly through the wine, giving a fresh, zingy aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Falua 2019 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Tejo)

Description: A soft, simple and attractively fruity wine, this is crisp and shot through with bright acidity. Red currant fruits and vivid freshness complete this refreshing wine.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Franck Millet 2019 Rosé (Sancerre)

Description: From a new range of organic wines from this producer, the wine comes from the mountainous eastern Beira region. With its soft red fruits and touches of spice from short oak aging, the wine has a fine balance and is ready to drink. Organic. Suitable for vegans.                      Roger Voss
Name: Casca Wines 2019 Monte Cascas Colheita Organic Rosé (Beira Interior)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Ballet slipper pink in the glass, the nose offers up yellow cherry, watermelon, beach grass and golden strawberry. Flavors of strawberry and white grapefruit meld with lime pith to form the palate, leading to a zesty lime finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Les Frères Bastards 2019 Grenache-Syrah-Merlot Rosé (Vin de France)

Description: This pale rosé from 100% Syrah is fresh and fruity with red fruits, crisp acidity and just a touch of spice. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Herdade do Sobroso 2019 Cellar Selection Syrah Rosé (Alentejo)

Description: Smooth, ripe fruit gives this wine weight and a dense texture. The acidity and freshness are less in evidence, leaving a wine that is full-bodied and rich. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Philippe Raimbault 2019 Apud Sariacum Rosé (Sancerre)

Description: This softly textured, fruity wine has some richness as well as tangy red berry flavors. The acidity is well balanced with the wine's fruity character, giving a perfumed, rounded aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2019 Domaine Santa Giulietta Rosé (Corse)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: A strong rose-petal aroma and spiced plum flavors mean this well-made wine is not going for subtlety. It's full in flavor, rich and rather soft in texture and tastes sweet on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: One Hope NV Vintner Collection Rosé (California)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: Lightly textured and with ripe berry fruits, this is a smooth wine. The acidity gives a fine touch of freshness to the wild strawberry fruits that are perfumed and refreshing. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2019 Gouleyant Rosé (Côtes du Lot)

Description: From typical chalk soil vineyards, the wine is full of crisp red currant and spice flavors. Its lively acidity gives it a fine, balanced aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Michel Vattan 2019 Rosé (Sancerre)

Description: There is a definite warm, Mediterranean feel to this ripe wine. Perfumed and lightly peppery, it has red berry flavors and a hint of tannins to give structure and turn this into a real food rosé. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clamens 2019 Négrette-Syrah Rosé (Fronton)

Description: Aragonez and Castelão come together in a lightly peppery and red currant-flavored wine. Crisp while also full in the mouth, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Howard's Folly 2019 Sonhador Rosé (Alentejano)

Description: The palest of rosés, emulating Provence, this wine is light and fruity. Despite the alcohol, it is all about freshness and lively acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Chavet 2019 Rosé (Menetou-Salon)

Description: Aragonez and Castelão come together in a lightly peppery and red currant-flavored wine. Crisp while also full in the mouth, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Howard's Folly 2019 Sonhador Rosé (Alentejano)

Description: There is a definite warm, Mediterranean feel to this ripe wine. Perfumed and lightly peppery, it has red berry flavors and a hint of tannins to give structure and turn this into a real food rosé. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clamens 2019 Négrette-Syrah Rosé (Fronton)

Appellation: Coteaux du Giennois, Loire Valley, France
Description: This Pinot Noir rosé is rich and fruity, with noticable alcoholic warmth. A shame, because the underlying red berry fruits are attractive. Definitely not for aperitif but for some rich food.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Villargeau 2019 Rosé (Coteaux du Giennois)

Description: Soft and fruity, the wine is open and lightly textured. With its tangy acidity and balanced fruit, it is bright, breezy and ready to drink. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Philippe Gilbert 2019 Rosé (Menetou-Salon)

Description: This is a fresh, crisp wine with bright acidity that brings out the red fruits. There is a distinct tangy character to this attractively fruity wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Obrigado 2019 Vera Rosé (Vinho Verde)

Description: This rosato opens with aromas of strawberry, blood orange and spring flowers. It's rich and full bodied on the palate, with ultratangy acidity that doesn't seem to quite integrate. There's smoothness up front, but the zesty acidity takes over come the midpalate and doesn't relent, ending a bit sharp.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenute Rubino 2019 Torre Testa Susumaniello Rosato (Salento)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Pale ballet pink, aromas of English thyme, lemon balm and yellow cherry are charming on the nose. The palate offers tart flavors of strawberry, yellow cherry and green apple, with lemony acidity leading to a delightful crushed mineral and lime finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Two Birds One Stone 2019 Cinsault Rosé (Vin de France)

Description: A fruity, ripe wine made 100% from Sciaccerellu, this is rich and full of wild strawberry flavors. The acidity saves the wine, giving a fresh and crisp aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2019 Terra Santa Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: This is a rich rosé that is full of ripe strawberry flavors. It is densely textured and tangy, with a burst of acidity at the end.                      Roger Voss
Name: François Crochet 2019 Rosé (Sancerre)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of strawberry and clean ash tones show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite sweet, with red-apple and candied berry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Midnight 2019 Luna Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: Delicate aromas of lemon blossom, banana and white flowers carry the nose. The medium-bodied palate is driven by vibrant acidity and a juicy candied watermelon flavor. The acidity is a bit sharp and biting on the midpalate but resolves well on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Apollonio 2019 Elfo Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)

Description: A fruity, ripe wine made 100% from Sciaccerellu, this is rich and full of wild strawberry flavors. The acidity saves the wine, giving a fresh and crisp aftertaste. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2019 Terra Santa Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: Syrah and Touriga Nacional in equal proportions give a wine that is all about fruitiness. With ripe strawberry flavors and a bright line in acidity, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2019 Rosé (Tejo)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of toast, vanilla, baking spice and strawberry, showing a lot of barrel influence. The palate shows more of the same. The wood gets in the way.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Limited Edition Cinsault Canyon Vineyard Ranch
Name: Canoe Ridge 2019 Limited Edition Cinsault Canyon Vineyard Ranch Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Description: Informal and refreshing, this light-bodied rosé has flavors suggesting tart sour cherry, unripe strawberry and a hint of saline. It's simple but well-made, with a crisp finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Benanti 2019 Rosato (Etna)

Description: This medium-bodied wine offers plenty of plum and cooked apricot flavors on a fairly rich texture. Is more meaty and mouthfilling than many.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cupcake 2019 Rosé (California)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a softly textured and really fruity rosé made from Malbec grown around Cahors. Its red currant fruits and bright acidity are immediately attractive and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2019 Pigmentum Rosé (Côtes du Lot)

Description: A caramel- and red fruit-flavored wine, this is pink in color with a smooth, rounded texture. Drink this attractive wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: DFJ Vinhos 2019 Paxis Rosé (Lisboa)

Description: An intriguing blend of Pinot Noir, Castelão and Syrah has produced a soft, smooth and wild strawberry flavored wine. It is fruity with enough acidity to balance the rich fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: DFJ Vinhos 2019 Portada Winemaker's Selection Rosé (Lisboa)

Description: This off-dry wine has a light prickle on the tongue. That lifts the ripe, strawberry flavored fruits and light structure. The wine is full of candy fruitiness. It's ready to drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Obrigado 2019 Nortico Rosé (Minho)

Description: This is a soft, semisweet rosé, a far cry from classic Provence. But it does have an attractive ripe crushed strawberry character that, served ice cold, will be refreshing.                      Roger Voss
Name: Maison Marcel 2019 Rosé (Mediterranée)

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This rosato is quite reserved on the nose, offering up hints of plastic and citrus. The palate follows suit, driven by feint citrus and melon flavors. It's balanced on the soft side and ends short.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Crifo 2019 Rosato (Castel del Monte)

Description: A warm, ripely fruity rosé, this has enough freshness to lift the raspberry flavors and caramel hints. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Casca Wines 2019 Cascas Winemaker's Selection Rosé (Lisboa)

Description: Part of a new venture from the owners of Château de Tracy in Pouilly-Fumé, the wine is rich, fruity with raspberry flavors and enough crispness to keep it fresh. The light pepper in the aftertaste is a sign of the alcohol.                      Roger Voss
Name: Tracy & Cie 2018 Madame des Fontaynes Les Marnes Rosé (Menetou-Salon)

Description: This is a ripe, peppery wine that has rich fruits and a tangy texture. Pepper and alcohol come from this full-bodied wine, just balanced by acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2019 Domaine Vetriccie Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A poolside-friendly plastic bottle contains a ripe blend of Grenache and Cinsault, with sweet strawberry flavors and a final touch of acidity. This wine is ready for a sunny day. Suitable for vegans.                      Roger Voss
Name: French Pool Toy 2019 Rosé (Vin de France)

Description: A crisp and fruity wine, bright with acidity and red currants, this is light and fresh. Made from Aragonez and Touriga Nacional, it is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2019 Dona Maria Rosé (Alentejo)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This millennial-pink rosé offers notes of mandarin oranges and gardenias on the nose. The palate brings strawberry and green pear flavors while the finish turns a little bitter.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Les Alliés 2019 Grenache Rosé (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Lemon-lime and white flower aromas form the nose of this pale millennial pink rosé. The palate delivers ripe lemons and limes alongside a grassy and pithy finish and crisp, mouthwatering acidity.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Jean Vincent 2019 Rosé (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Millennial pink in color, aromas of fresh picked cherry and strawberry are brightened by a squeeze of lemon on the nose. The juicy palate starts with flavors of cherry and strawberry before diving into red apple skin and lime peel. It shows lemony acidity and a chalky mouthfeel, with a floral accent on the mineral-laden finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Doudet Naudin 2019 Pinot Noir Rosé (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Fresh oranges, lemons and blossom aromas waft from this rich salmon-pink wine. Flavors of orange peel and juicy grapefruit are lifted by zesty acidity, but it turns a bit bitter and pithy on the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Florent Descombe 2019 Syrah Rosé (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Ultapale pink in color, this wine displays grass clippings and dandelions on the nose. The neutral palate feels flat, but is loaded in a pithy lime flavor and a zesty finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Le Val 2019 Grenache Rosé (Vin de France)

Description: Pyrazines, peach pit aromas and citrus notes carry the nose on this tangy, gritty Malbec rosé. Hollow citrus and stone fruit flavors are lean and slightly bitter on the finish. Overall there isn't much to this.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Calcu 2019 Reserva Especial Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

Description: A pale color and barely perceptible aromas of peach pit and matchstick open this tight-bodied rosé of Carmenère. Soda cracker flavors show merely a hint of red fruit character, while this is yeasty tasting and empty on the back end.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Apaltagua 2019 Reserva Carmenere Rosé (Maule Valley)

Description: The Espadeiro is one of the red grapes of Vinho Verde. Here it makes an orange-colored rosé that has a caramel edge as well as crisp acidity, making the wine unbalanced.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta de Gomariz 2019 Espadeiro Rosé (Vinho Verde)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Ballet slipper pink in the glass, this wine starts off with aromas of honeydew melon, fresh lime and yellow apple. The palate delivers tart green apple and bitter lime pith alongside notes of hay. The lime flavor ripens towards the finish, but ultimately this leans a bit sour on the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Nic Rager 2019 Rosé (Vin de France)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Pale copper in color, this wine smells like it is a bowl of wet stones, sprinkled with bits of dried strawberry, dried orange peel and lime zest—thoroughly fascinating. Fresh, focused, vibrant flavors follow, showing depth, intensity, detail, texture and purity. Stone and strawberry notes linger on the finish. It's a little sip of rosé nirvana.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cayuse 2018 Edith Grenache Armada Vineyard Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this rosé blend of 65% Grenache, 19% Mourvèdre and 16% Picpoul Blanc is extremely inviting, offering cherry and strawberry as well as chalky aromas. That talc-like crushed white-rock minerality is firm on the palate, framing the strawberry-flesh and rosewater flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Halter Ranch 2019 Rosé (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pale-pink in color, this pink blend of 50% Mourvèdre and 50% Grenache shows rose petals, light berry and sliced pluot on the sharp and pinpoint nose. The palate is framed by a stony grip, delivering flavors of Rainier cherry, light strawberry and crisp nectarine, with searing acidity into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Samsara 2019 Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Inspired by two beloved types of roses named for Ingrid Bergman and Julia Child, also grown on winemaker Julie Johnson's estate, this is an ideal garden quaffer. High in acidity, it sings in grapefruit and tangerine, remaining gracefully refreshing and structured.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Tres Sabores 2019 Ingrid and Julia Rosé (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light and tight aromas of lime, strawberry and crushed stone show on the nose of this blend of 76% Grenache, 19% Mourvèdre and 5% Counoise. There is a strong stony streak on the palate, where a brisk acidity delivers flavors of melon, nectarine and light berry.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tablas Creek 2019 Patelin de Tablas Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: Red berry, Mediterranean scrub and wildflower aromas form the alluring nose on this Nerello Mascalese and Nerello Cappuccio blend. On the bright, savory palate, tangy acidity accompanies juicy red cherry, blood orange and star anise before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Custodi delle Vigne dell'Etna 2019 Contrada Mugnazzi Alnus Rosato (Etna)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This intriguing blend of 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Sauvignon Blanc delivers a reminder that rosé can be made in many ways. A beautiful shade of pink, the wine begins with aromas of red plum, lanolin and wet gravel on the nose. The palate is very textural, mixing up plump pluot flavors with grassy, dried pasilla elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lady of the Sunshine 2019 Rosé (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A clean version of pét-nat, this sparkler begins with aromas of pink lemon, apricot blossom and a hint of strawberry on the nose. The flavors are crisp and focused, showing light apricot and red pear, which ride a very generous mousse.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Solminer 2019 Poils de Chien Pet-Nat Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Using both Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris, whole-cluster pressing the grapes after time on the skins, this is a crisp, refreshingly complex wine, bright and lengthy on the palate in sophisticated flavors of strawberry and white peach.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stewart 2019 Rosé (Sonoma Mountain)

Description: Fruity and fresh, this savory rosato opens with aromas of red berry, blue flowers and citrus. Made entirely with Nerello Mascalese, the racy, delicious palate doles out tangy strawberry, blood orange and saline mineral notes before a baking spice close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Torre Mora 2019 Scalunera Nerello Mascalese Rosato (Etna)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The very delicate and pleasant nose of this rosé begins with rose petals and lots of crushed wet stone. A tightly wound texture delivers brisk flavors of light strawberry, Rainier cherry and a touch of lanolin-like earthiness.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Martin Ranch 2019 Therese Vineyards Victoria Denice Vineyard Rosé (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Grenache (70%) makes up the heart of this wine, with the rest Mourvèdre. Coming from Upland and Heart of the Hill vineyards respectively, the aromas offer notes of strawberry, mineral, sweet herb and a whiff of orange zest. The palate is fuller in style, bringing a sense of weight, texture and seriousness, while possessing more than enough acidity to keep it all together. It shows impressive length. Give it a short decant.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Avennia 2019 L'Egérie Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Riviera del Garda Classico, Lombardy, Italy
Description: A juicy blend of Marzemino, Groppello, Sangiovese and Barbera, this delicious, copper-colored rosato has heady aromas of spring wildflowers, stone fruit and Alpine herb. It's bright and savory, offering juicy peach, tart cherry, white pepper and a hint of pink grapefruit before a tangy, almost salty close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Selva Capuzza 2019 Chiaretto San Donino Rosé (Riviera del Garda Classico)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though it's two years past vintage, this wine has only profited from the extra aging. Sourced from Dundee Hills vineyards, it's aromatic, with scents and flavors of peaches and vanilla. There's a well-detailed finish, which brings in grace notes of cinnamon and toast.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Rambeaux 2018 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Description: This bold rosato starts off with an integrated nose of peach, banana and melon, while bright shots of pink grapefruit and spice add lift. It's rounded and juicy on the palate, showing a pleasing progression of berry and melon flavors that are accented by orange-laden acidity. Wet stone and citrus peels add depth and grip, and contribute to the lingering finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenute Rubino 2019 Saturnino Negroamaro Rosato (Brindisi)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light raspberry, delicate cotton candy, brisk melon and a hint of citrus show on the nose of this pale rosé. There's great zip and a tense texture to the sip, where ash and talc flavors meet with rounded red plum, strawberry and watermelon, all sliced by strong acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bonny Doon 2019 Vin Gris de Cigare Rosé (Central Coast)

Description: Made entirely from Zinfandel, this is a refreshingly light, bright and intentional wine, zippy, herbal and citrus-driven, with a fruity undercurrent of wild strawberry. Dry and pretty in pink color, it offers complexity within its undeniable appeal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mauritson 2019 Rosé (Rockpile)

Description: Made entirely from Zinfandel, this is a refreshingly light, bright and intentional wine, zippy, herbal and citrus-driven, with a fruity undercurrent of wild strawberry. Dry and pretty in pink color, it offers complexity within its undeniable appeal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mauritson 2019 Rosé (Rockpile)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Mourvèdre makes up three-quarters of this wine, with the rest Grenache. Showing just a tinge of copper color, expressive aromas of rhubarb, grapefruit and white peach are followed by a tart, flavorful palate with snappy acidity. It shows a lovely sense of layering and intensity, delivering more seriousness than is typically found in domestic pinks without sacrificing one iota of pleasure.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Devison 2019 Boushey Vineyard Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in color, this pink blend of 46% Grenache, 28% Mourvèdre, 24% Cinsault and 2% Syrah offers delicate aromas of watermelon and a brisk hit of citrus on the nose. It's tight and bright on the sip, where apple-flesh and nectarine flavors cling to a tense texture and flashy acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Clos Solène 2019 La Rose Rosé (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is all Grenache, fermented and aged in concrete. So pale in color it could easily pass for a white wine, the aromas are reserved at present, while the palate is expressive, fuller in feel, with strawberry and pink-grapefruit flavors framed by zippy, lemony acidity. It's still settling in but has excellent stuffing. Give it a short decant.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Grosgrain 2019 Blush Angiolina Farm Grenache Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Far beyond a simple quaffer, this is a classy, detailed wine built upon a solid foundation of rhubarb, strawberry and cherry pastry. There's a bit of a whipped cream character, or maybe lemon meringue, adding depth and texture. Along with Quady North, 2Hawk is making a very strong case for placing Rogue Valley Grenache rosés among the best in the country.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: 2Hawk 2019 Grenache Rosé (Rogue Valley)

Description: This iconic bottling from a historic estate offers a zesty, fresh nose of pink grapefruit, crushed black pepper and melon. The palate is cohesive and lifted in tones of strawberry, melon and citrus, with a gentle floral kick on the midpalate and a gentle cherry skin note on the lingering close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Leone de Castris 2019 Five Roses Rosato (Salento)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean and pure aromas of watermelon and strawberry are joyous but properly reserved on the nose of this pink blend of 63% Mourvèdre and 37% Grenache. The palate is crisp and chalky in texture, delivering strawberry cream, watermelon juice and tangy lime flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cass 2019 Oasis Rosé (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is all Grenache, fermented and aged in concrete. So pale in color it could easily pass for a white wine, the aromas are reserved at present, while the palate is expressive, fuller in feel, with strawberry and pink-grapefruit flavors framed by zippy, lemony acidity. It's still settling in but has excellent stuffing. Give it a short decant.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Grosgrain 2019 Blush Angiolina Farm Grenache Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Complex fruit flavors and a snappy texture make this medium-bodied wine both refreshing and satisfying. Brilliant sour cherry and rich grapefruit notes light up the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Banshee 2019 Rosé (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: An astonishing value, this all-Pinot rosé is scented with luxurious rose petals and piercing citrus rind. The palate cascades through watermelon and strawberry flavors, not sweet but round and full in feel. There's a lively spiciness as it winds down and the finish just doesn't quit.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Samuel Robert 2019 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Subtle on the nose at first, this delicate rosé shows aromas of chilly Alpine water, light cherry, brisk strawberry and a unique hint of papaya. It's very crisp and alkaline on the palate, where ashy flavors meet with very light red fruits and texturally engaging citrus pith.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2019 Rosé (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is pale-copper in color. Pleasing (though light) aromas of wet stone and grapefruit lead to fuller-feeling grapefruit and white-peach flavors. A citrusy finish caps it off. It delivers a lot of flavor intensity and length.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Time & Direction 2019 UpUpDownDownLeftRightLeftRightBASelectStart Thunderstone Vineyard Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: This pink blend of 52% Tempranillo, 46% Grenache, 1% Mourvèdre and 1% Roussanne is in the running for L.A.'s best rosé ever, admittedly not a huge category. Clean aromas of blood orange, rose, red apple, orange sherbet and strawberry lead into a palate with candied melon and ripe peach. A cement-like texture drives it home.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cavaletti 2019 The 109 Mile Rosé (Los Angeles County)

Description: This nicely balanced wine combines a light, crisp feel with substantive and concentrated fruit flavors that grow and expand on the palate, making it especially appetizing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Flat Top Hills 2019 Rosé (California)

Description: Refreshing and savory, this tangy Nerello Mascalese rosato has fruity and floral aromas of wild red berry, orchard fruit and Spanish broom. The crisp palate offers juicy sour cherry, peach and pink grapefruit before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gambino 2019 Tifeo Rosato (Etna)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This one-of-a-kind wine in the state is led by Cinsault (44%), followed by Grenache (28%) and Syrah. A pretty pale-salmon color, the aromas offer notes of strawberry, herb, melon, mineral and tangerine peel. The palate is medium bodied in style, with mouthwatering acidity accenting the fruit flavors. Tasty stuff.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gramercy 2019 Olsen Vineyard Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: With 75% Syrah and 25% Grenache in the mix, this wine is copper-colored and metallic on the tongue—a textured element of stainless-steel influence—with a crisp, underlying acidity that supports earthy lemon peel and grapefruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Picayune 2019 Hay Penny Rosé (Mendocino County)

Description: Wet stone, light lemon peel and brisk aromas of underrripe strawberry show on the nose of this pink blend of 50% Mourvèdre and 50% Grenache. The palate zings with lemon-peel acidity at first and then leads into warmer hints of nectarine in the midpalate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Joyce 2019 Turbidity Current Rosé (Monterey)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: With 75% Syrah and 25% Grenache in the mix, this wine is copper-colored and metallic on the tongue—a textured element of stainless-steel influence—with a crisp, underlying acidity that supports earthy lemon peel and grapefruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Picayune 2019 Hay Penny Rosé (Mendocino County)

Description: Set on the heights above the Garonne river, this estate has produced a crisply fruity wine, with attractive acidity and a touch of tannins. Made from Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine has structure while never losing sight of the attractive red fruits. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Laubès 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A pale copper-salmon color, this is focused and tart, sporting sour plum and cherry flavors. There are more tannins than the color might suggest, and they beef up the finish and add some staying power to the wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Apolloni 2019 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Description: A slick nose of wet stone, papaya and watermelon starts off this well-balanced rosato. The flavors build on the palate, beginning with a melon tone that leads to crushed strawberry and blood orange. There's a gentle tannic grip and fresh acidity to house all the fruit, with a lick of peppery spice to add depth, while crushed cherry skins linger on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Castello Monaci 2019 Kreos Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A full-bodied style, this pushes pretty strawberry fruit dappled with white pepper. The vibrant acids bring a touch of citrus, and the wine is so round and ripe it feels almost fleshy.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Hamacher 2019 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Description: A bright, boisterous nose of peach, melon and apricot starts off this fruity but balanced rosato. Rounded and juicy in feel, the palate offers creamy melon and stone fruit flavors upfront that progress to more citric elements of grapefruit and orange zest. It ends on a lingering apricot peel note that leaves a crisp, delightfully tactical sensation.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masseria Li Veli 2019 Primerose Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A textbook Oregon rosé produced entirely from Pinot Noir, this is bursting with watermelon and strawberry fruit flavors, and backed with juicy acidity. It's a fresh, clean, elegant and most quaffable style.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2019 Estate Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Brisk aromas of wet stone, orange peel and melon greet the nose on this widely available bottling. There is a grippy texture to the sip, where soft rose-petal, lemon peel, strawberry and Rainier cherry flavors align.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chloe 2019 Rosé (Central Coast)

Description: This wine's name is a reminder that the Atlantic coast close to Bordeaux has the highest sand dune, Pilat, in Europe.Soft, fruity and full of forward strawberry flavors, the wine is touched by caramel and spice that contrast with the tangy acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Delor 2019 Villa des Dunes Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: A bright, boisterous nose of peach, melon and apricot starts off this fruity but balanced rosato. Rounded and juicy in feel, the palate offers creamy melon and stone fruit flavors upfront that progress to more citric elements of grapefruit and orange zest. It ends on a lingering apricot peel note that leaves a crisp, delightfully tactical sensation.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Masseria Li Veli 2019 Primerose Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In keeping with its season, this is a heartier offering of rosé. A pretty light-bronze, the aromas bring appealing notes of cantaloupe, melon rind and citrus. Broad-feeling flavors follow. The balance is lovely.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: SMAK 2019 Fall/Winter Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This relies on 94% Syrah to do the heavy lifting, complemented by 6% Grenache. Cherry, raspberry and vanilla flavors sizzle in crisp companions of tangerine and grapefruit, with a meaty backdrop contributing varietal complexity and texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Paraduxx 2019 Rosé (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine comes from the well-known and grand Fronsac estate west of Saint-Emilion. Well-judged crispness allows for bright acidity as well as wild-strawberry flavors. Perfumed and deliciously fruity, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de la Dauphine 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though the actual variety content is unknown, this appears to be made from Pinot Noir, with pretty aromas of rose petals and wild strawberries. The juicy acidity keeps it lively and fresh, and the floral highlights add a touch of elegance.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Greetings 2019 Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a powerful fruit-driven wine. Flavors of ripe grapefruit, crisp apple and hints of lemon peel combine in a lovely bottle that would be a perfect companion to cold chicken.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abacela 2019 Grenache Rosé (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Aromatic and rich in spice as well as tangy acidity, this wine is fruity in a raspberry flavor. Zesty acidity lends plenty of balance. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Marsan 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This blended rosé is principally Pinot Gris, with 10% Pinot Noir providing the color. It's fresh and leesy, with a crisp underlying minerality. The fruit flavors run to strawberry and white melon, with excellent length.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Fullerton 2019 Three Otters Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Description: Light aging on lees has given this wine depth as well as an attractive spicy character. The wine is ripe, full of white fruits with a citrus edge. It would be best with food and is ready to drink. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Suau 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: Very fresh and flavorful, this medium-bodied, dry wine offers dazzling raspberry aromas and flavors, good balance and a soothingly smooth texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Berrycream 2019 Rosé (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from Lawrence Vineyard, aromas of strawberry and herb are followed by light, bright, puckering flavors. It brings a pleasing sense of acidity.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Eternal 2019 Eternal Beauty Grenache Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A deep-pink color and substantial berry flavors make this wine more than an apéritif. Good acidity lifts raspberry and cranberry flavors for an appetizing palate-cleansing effect.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2019 Estate Bottled Rosé (El Dorado)

Description: Fresh and fragrant, this has aromas of wisteria and tropical fruit with a whiff of botanical herb. On the tangy palate, vibrant acidity accompanies peach, banana and sour cherry.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cottanera 2019 Nerello Mascalese Rosato (Etna)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pretty pale-pink color, the aromas bring bright notes of watermelon, cherry and melon. Full-feeling, just off-dry-drinking kiwi flavors follow. For those looking for a delicious, fruity, off-dry rosé with enough acid to pull it off, look no further.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Roaming Dog 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale-salmon in color, with a slight orange tinge, bright aromas of yellow strawberry and melon lead to juicy orange-peel and strawberry flavors. There's a lot to like.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Three Forks 2019 Gamache Vineyard Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light and delicate on the nose, this rosé starts with aromas of red plum and lime. The palate is singed with acidity, offering flavors of orange rind and strawberry.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vincent Vineyards 2019 Cabriole Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This well-priced offering is rounded and ripe in flavors of crushed strawberry, melon and blood orange. It's built by vibrant acidity that carries all the fruit quite well, lending lift and vitality, while also allowing the flavors to shine.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Coppi 2019 Coré Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)

Description: This tangy, light-bodied wine delivers good refreshment and enjoyable light berry flavors on a crisp and appetizing texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Minus Tide 2019 Feliz Creek Vineyard Carignan Rosé (Mendocino)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All Cabernet Franc from the Two Blondes vineyard, this is a pale-copper hue, with a delicious core of fruit centered around lemons and peaches. Most interesting is a whiff of warm spices—the same flavors that carry on through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pearl and Stone 2019 Unemployment Beach Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Description: This light- to medium-bodied wine, made from mostly Tempranillo grapes, shows appetizing acidity, light watermelon and raspberry flavors and a good, crisp texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Anarchist Wine Co. 2019 Against The Machine Rosé (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a pretty pale-peach color. Strawberry, watermelon and sweet herb aromas are followed by well-balanced flavors. It's a charmer.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Ducleaux 2018 One Night Stand Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from a producer dedicated to the production of rosé, this wine is pale-bronze in color. The aromas are not ready to reveal themselves out of the gate, with light notes of cherry, strawberry and herb. Tart mouthwatering flavors follow. One would like to see more generosity aromatically, but the palate delivers.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: SMAK 2019 Spring Sangiovese Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Clean and well-structured, this wine comes from this Lurton family estate in the Entre-deux-Mers. It has bright acidity, with an herbal hint giving great freshness. This red-fruit-flavored wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour de Bonnet 2019 Merlot-Cabernet Savignon Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This blend is softly textured, with a touch of pepper as well as plenty of acidity. Still young, it shows the potential for fruitiness that will be expressed soon. Drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château des Tourtes 2019 Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This wild, earthy rosato shows lifted tones of strawberry and Mediterranean scrub. It's juicy and crunchy in feel, with fruit, earth and tannins all in harmony. A slick of tangy wet stone marks the brisk close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Valentina Passalacqua 2018 Negroamaro Rosato (Puglia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Syrah (71%) takes the lead on this wine, with the rest Grenache, Mourvèdre and bits of Cabernet Sauvignon and Counoise. Substantially lighter in color than recent vintages, the aromas are reductive out of the gate. They open to reveal pleasing notes of watermelon, strawberry and herb. The palate is light, brisk and focused, with plenty of acidity to keep the interest high. It only gets better with time open.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Charles & Charles 2019 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This soft, ripe wine offers generous red fruits and well-balanced acidity. A touch of caramel comes from Merlot in the blend. The fruity wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Thieuley 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring appeal, with notes of strawberry, herb and melon rind. The flavors are dry and broad in feel. It brings a lot of charm.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dixie & Bass 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This rosé of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre is a very pretty pale-peach color. Aromas of cut apple, biscuit and gummy are followed by lightly styled, center-focused flavors. It pulls up on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Ducleaux 2018 Pink Slip Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
