Description: This generous and fruity wine made from Rhône grape varieties leads with ripe honeydew melon aromas and adds peach and cantaloupe flavors on a medium body and nicely rounded texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Vie Winery 2019 Belle-Amie Rosé (North Coast)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This blended rosé is composed of 40% Pinot Noir, 20% Gamay Noir, 30% Gewürztraminer and 10% Riesling. Despite the aromatic white grapes, it's the Pinot and Gamay that dominate, with big-bodied flavors of strawberries and cherries, apples and citrus. It's more substantial than all-Pinot rosés, yet less refined, with a chunky mouthfeel.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Martin Woods 2019 Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Description: Perfumed Cabernet Franc gives this wine ripeness, crispness and wild-raspberry flavors. It is tangy and juicy, with fruitiness at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château du Claouset 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: Though the label reads simply rosé, this is 100% Pinot Noir. A coppery rose color, it's nicely loaded with fruit flavors of watermelon and strawberry, and finishes tart and dry.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Elouan 2019 Rosé (Oregon)

Description: Whole-cluster pressed Pinot Noir grapes were fermented in stainless-steel for this crisp, fleshy wine. Grapefruit, tangerine and strawberry accent an earthy foundation of thick tannin and grippy texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gehricke 2019 Rosé (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tart and tangy aromas of citrus-sprayed strawberries show on the nose of rosé, which is beautiful in color. The red-fruit flavors pop on the sip and then are consumed by the tangy tangerine and mandarin flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vincent Vineyards 2019 La Chaine Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A slightly brown shade of pink in the glass, this bottling begins with earthy aromas of cola, vanilla and light cherry. There is a zip to the sip, where dried cherry, orange rind and more cola flavors prove pleasantly refreshing.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: St. Eva Hill 2019 Rosé (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A unique blend of 60% Tinta Roriz, 35% Primitivo and 5% Grenache, this is a light and lively wine, finished quite dry with modest alcohol. Hints of berry, apple and a whiff of ham make it more than one-dimensional.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Troon 2019 Kubli Bench Rosé (Applegate Valley)

Description: Ripe strawberries are cut with crisper red currants in this attractively perfumed, Cabernet Franc-based wine. Acidity balances the tangy texture. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lauduc 2019 Classic Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This unabashedly fruity wine smells and tastes like just-picked grapes. It's pure, focused and straightforward, offering excellent refreshment and a lively texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dark Horse 2019 Rosé (California)

Description: This attractive wine aims to do everything 100%. It's from organic vines and is totally Merlot. Even the label foregoes tree paper for sugar cane, hemp and flax fibers. The wine is fresh, balanced with a crisp texture that sings with red-berry flavors, perfumed acidity and a bright aftertaste. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Delor 2019 Nature Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red-plum skin, underripe orange flesh and a earthy kick of lanolin show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines a taut texture and splash of acidity with orange flesh, lime peel and more earth tones.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Caliza 2019 Pink Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: The reserved nose of this wine offers hints of grapefruit, melon and peppery spice. The palate is more giving in the same mix of tones, with a pleasantly plump feel that's well balanced.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantele 2019 Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale-bronze in color, the aromas bring notes of grape skin and lees. A full-feeling palate follows. It loses a bit of its balance on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: SMAK 2019 Summer Pinot Gris Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This 100% Cabernet Franc rosé offers spicy, perfumed and ripe strawberry flavors. The weight and richness are balanced by final zesty acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Roquefort 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though not made in the Champagne method, this is neither simple nor clumsy. In fact the unusual blend—52% Pinot Noir, 28% Pinot Gris, 17% Tempranillo and 3% Maréchal Foch—holds together well. Flavors of citrus, strawberry and red cherry come together with a hint of toast from barrel fermentation. It's sealed with a crown cap and ready for immediate enjoyment.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2019 Sparkling Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Description: Made from 100% Cabernet Franc, this is an attractively perfumed, crisp wine. It is light and fruity, flavors of raspberries mingling with a light herbal, stalky character. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Rosé de Chambrun 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fragrant with a range of tree fruits, there is an inherent earthy character that puts some grit into the finish—a bit odd for a rosé. The light apple and citrus flavors seem slightly overmatched by the tannins, but a good hard cheese will fix all that.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Second Growth 2019 Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Description: This ripe, perfumed wine offers an interplay between Merlot and Cabernet Franc. It is full in the mouth and packed with fruit. The wine's acidity is of a piece with its richness, giving a bright edge to the aftertaste. Drink now. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Gabriel and Co. 2019 Château les Garelles Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This refreshing wine has a good balance between crispness and orange-peel flavors on the one hand and ripe, red fruitiness on the other. Lightly textured, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Vermont 2019 Sensation Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are reserved in style, with notes of melon and herb, along with wheat and a light medicinal note. The flavors are full but also sleek in style, with plenty of acidity backing it up. There are interesting things happening, but they don't all come together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gård 2019 Grand Klasse Lawrence Estate Wines Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle, citrus and honeydew lead the nose on this bright rosato. The aromas carry over to the tangy palate along with white peach and a hint of red berry. It closes crisp and clean.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giovanna Tantini 2019  Bardolino Chiaretto

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle, citrus and honeydew lead the nose on this bright rosato. The aromas carry over to the tangy palate along with white peach and a hint of red berry. It closes crisp and clean.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giovanna Tantini 2019  Bardolino Chiaretto

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A deep cranberry hue, this is scented with rose petals and vanilla wafers. The fruit brings ripe strawberries and pie cherries front and center. It's a big wine for a rosé, with enough concentration to anchor a meal of poultry, salmon or pork.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Red Hills Cellars 2019 Grenache Rosé (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is made from a field blend of Cinsault, Carignan, Grenache and Zinfandel—the result aged a year in neutral French oak. Thick in tannin and a whiff of earth, it wraps itself around layers of watermelon, grapefruit and lime.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Spicy Vines 2018 Violet Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pretty pale-peach color, the aromas are forward, with notes of watermelon, ripe strawberry and herb. Plentiful kiwi flavors follow. It's a charmer.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Be Human 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Coming from vineyards in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers, this wine is soft, fruity with raspberry flavors but also cut with acidity. The wine is very ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Roc de Minvielle 2019 Cuvée Les Tourelles Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Note that this is essentially Pinot Gris, with just 2% Pinot Noir added to give it a rosé hue. Flavors are white wine all the way, light citrus and apple, with plenty of acid.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Croft Vineyards 2019 Ridge Roamer Pinot Gris Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Description: The fun and playful packaging on this canned rosé should win awards. The wine itself is just fine, offering aromas of light nectarine and red pear. There is a decent sizzle of acidity on the sip, though it fades quickly, leading through light peach and more red-apple flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Beach Juice 2019 Rosé (California)

Description: Zesty aromas of peppery spice and tomato vine meld with creamy melon on the nose. The rounded palate brings flavors of banana, melon and orange that are initially lifted and pure but end a bit short.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tormaresca 2019 Calafuria Rosato (Salento)

Description: This light-bodied and overtly sweet wine smells just as ripe and honeyed as it tastes, exuding potent floral plummy candied notes from the first whiff through the lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Electra 2019 Moscato Rosé (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A salmon-color in the glass, this rosé is quite light on the nose, offering cherry and wet clay aromas. There's a touch of cherry sweetness to the palate, yet with enough stony minerality to keep it refreshing.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chronic Cellars 2019 Pink Pedals Rosé (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Merlot, with bits of Syrah and Cabernet Franc finishing it off. Pale-peach in color, it's reductive out of the gate, with notes of struck match and savory tones in front of cherry and tangerine. The palate is medium bodied, with cherry flavors and a pleasing mouthwatering sense to it.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: J. Bookwalter 2019 Scarlet Hexflame Conner Lee Vineyard Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Immediately attractive, this offers ripe fruits and crisp acidity. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon blend for a stylish, fresh, ready-to-drink wine.                      Roger Voss
Name: Kressmann 2019 Croix Saint-Martin Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lots of fruit flavors and a broad, almost sweet mouthfeel make this full-bodied wine unusually soft for a rosé, but flavorful and enjoyable.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Le Casque 2019 Vin Gris Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This rich wine is full of ripe strawberry fruits. The color is relatively dark for a modern rosé, underlining the ripeness and the full fruitiness of this ready-to-drink wine.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Gabriel and Co. 2019 Château Marot Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This medium-bodied wine is quite dry, offering a prosciutto aroma and white-pepper flavors. It's an unusual style of rosé that has a serious, savory appeal.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fasi Estate 2019 Estate Syrah Rosé (Madera)

Description: Showing the ripe fruit of the vintage, this balanced wine has a good combination of acidity with bright berry fruits and a tangy texture that gives it freshness and a great lift. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Pertignas 2019 Rosé de Pertignas Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale-salmon in color, forward aromas of wild strawberry, whole tangerine and kiwi lead to just off-dry, heavier styled flavors that gets bogged down.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2019 Limited Release Le Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a blended and fruity rosé, not made with Pinot Noir, other than as a color-adding grape. Apple and pear fruit dominates, with a light hint of wild strawberries. It's full bodied and pleasant, in a simple but satisfying style.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Conveyance 2019 Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of Spanish broom with a whiff of red berry are behind the delicate nose. On the round, medium-bodied palate, fennel notes back up pomegranate and red cherry before a salty close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vigne Chigi 2019 Rosa Canina Pallagrello Nero Rosato (Terre del Volturno)

Description: This rich blend with 60% Merlot has layers of ripe red-berry fruits. The wine is touched with acidity, leaving space for its fruitiness and final edge of perfumed caramel. Drink this attractive wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Gabriel and Co. 2019 Château les Aubiers Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a blended and fruity rosé, not made with Pinot Noir, other than as a color-adding grape. Apple and pear fruit dominates, with a light hint of wild strawberries. It's full bodied and pleasant, in a simple but satisfying style.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Conveyance 2019 Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dunnigan Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Ripe peach and plum flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine are quite rich and the texture is rather soft and mouthfilling.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Matchbook 2019 Tinto Rey Estate Bottled Rosé (Dunnigan Hills)

Description: With over 80% Cabernet Franc in the blend, this wine is perfumed, with fresh acidity to balance the crisp red-berry flavors. The wine is attractively fruity, light and ready to drink. Suitable for vegans.                      Roger Voss
Name: Caves de Rauzan 2019 Fleur Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: Bright and crisp, this fruity rosé has attractive structure as well as red fruits. Made from Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine has just a touch of tannin to give it shape. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Despagne 2019 Oh La La! Le Rosé Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This refreshing, crisp wine has a good balance between red fruits and bright acidity. The texture is light and lively. Drink this attractive wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Penin 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: Made from 100% Cabernet Franc, this is a perfumed, fruity wine. Crisp red-currant fruits have a spicy character that allows this attractive wine to shine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Dourthe 2019 La Grande Cuvée Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: Bright and crisp, this fruity rosé has attractive structure as well as red fruits. Made from Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine has just a touch of tannin to give it shape. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Despagne 2019 Oh La La! Le Rosé Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: With over 80% Cabernet Franc in the blend, this wine is perfumed, with fresh acidity to balance the crisp red-berry flavors. The wine is attractively fruity, light and ready to drink. Suitable for vegans.                      Roger Voss
Name: Caves de Rauzan 2019 Fleur Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This soft, caramel and raspberry-flavored wine is a 50/50 blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. It is vibrant and fruity, with plenty of acidity to go with the riper aftertaste. Drink this refreshing wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Kressmann 2019 Pink de Kressmann Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Syrah makes up 94% of this wine, with the rest bits of Grenache and Mourvèdre. It is cherry-red in color, which is dark by modern standards. Aromas of crayon and watermelon candy are followed off-dry flavors that need more acidity to stand them up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Spring Run 2019 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With touches of caramel and richness from red fruits, this is an attractive blend of the three main Bordeaux grapes. It is full of vivid fruitiness, ripe and full in the mouth. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2018 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: A blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this is crisp, tight with tangy acidity as well as red fruits. Fresh and laced with red currants, the wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tassin 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This soft wine has ripe strawberry fruits and a fresher side of acidity. It is light and perfumed, finishing with a touch of caramel.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de l'Aubrade 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is 92% Pinot Gris, with 7% Pinot Noir, mostly for color, and a splash of Muscat, presumably for enhanced aromatics. Apple flavors, with a light hint of strawberry, pretty much sum it up. It's a pleasant, but rather nondescript style of rosé.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Four Graces 2019 Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Reductive out of the gate, this wine shows aromas of rock salt and nori in front of cherry, strawberry and watermelon. Apple and slightly leesy-seeming flavors follow. It seems past peak.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: And why am I Mr. Pink?
Name: Underground Wine Project 2018 And why am I Mr. Pink? Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A delicate nose of white blossoms, pollen and citrus holds a hint of herbal spice in the background. Creamy on the palate, it shows subdued flavors of strawberry and melon, ending short but refreshing.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vespa 2019 Flarò il Rosa dei Vespa Rosato (Salento)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Reductive out of the gate, this wine shows aromas of rock salt and nori in front of cherry, strawberry and watermelon. Apple and slightly leesy-seeming flavors follow. It seems past peak.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: And why am I Mr. Pink?
Name: Underground Wine Project 2018 And why am I Mr. Pink? Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A delicate nose of white blossoms, pollen and citrus holds a hint of herbal spice in the background. Creamy on the palate, it shows subdued flavors of strawberry and melon, ending short but refreshing.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Vespa 2019 Flarò il Rosa dei Vespa Rosato (Salento)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Mourvèdre (55%) is in the lead on this wine, with the rest Grenache (40%) and a splash of Syrah. Starting out slightly reductive, this wine opens to show notes of medicine, strawberry and spice. Light but lively flavors follow.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Efeste 2019 Oldfield Estate Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Description: Cabernet Franc takes the lead in this blend, giving spiciness and richness. It is a shame that the wine also has high alcohol that adds a pepper edge to the weight. The wine is more for food and is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la France 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This fruity wine has attractive textured acidity and crisp red-currant flavors. A hint of caramel gives richness and softens the intense acidity that shoots through the wine. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Fontenille 2019 Belle Rosée de Fontenille Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This smooth blend with almost equal proportions of the three main Bordeaux red grapes is gentle and rounded. A zingy aftertaste brings in the acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château La Gabarre 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: In the same family for four generations, this estate has produced a ripe rosé. Caramel as well as strawberry flavors give richness along with a bitter edge that needs to soften. Drink this wine from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Verrière 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: Mainly Cabernet Franc, this wine is perfumed, spicy and with an attractive bite of acidity. It is lively and full of juicy fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lamothe 2019 Miette Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: Light caramel flavors are balanced by crisp acidity and red-berry flavors to give a wine that bright, crisply texture and packed with fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chai de Bordes 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This lightly tangy wine has a spicy character as well as refreshing acidity that complements the red-currant fruits, bite of pepper and backdrop of caramel. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Fonfroide 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This soft and fruity wine with caramel Merlot flavors is simple, ripe and refreshing. A light, crisp edge comes from the final acidity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Milord 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This bright wine offers hints of caramel flavors as well as red-currant freshness. The wine is lightly textured, tangy and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour de Goupin 2019 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: It seems that Acrobat has dumped its all-Pinot Noir rosé in favor of this simple Pinot Gris, colored with a splash of its red brother. Although this is pink like a rosé, in terms of flavor it just a light, tart, generic Pinot Gris.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Acrobat 2019 Rosé (Oregon)

Description: Light in body and lean in flavor, this nervy, tangy wine is refreshing and simple.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Nola Grace 2019 Dry Rosé (California)

Description: A soft wine with ripe, almost sweet strawberry fruits, this is light and gently textured. It is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: A. de Luze et Fils 2019 De Luze Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This dark-pink-colored wine offers rich fruitiness, with an intense strawberry flavor. The ripeness has been exaggerated by heavy-handed color and flavor extraction. Drink the wine now. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château de Lisennes 2019 7 Hectares Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: Red-currant fruits have a ripe character that is enhanced by the nutty quality of this wine. Softly textured and with a pinch of spice, it is rich and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Haut-Mouleyre 2019 Rosé Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Description: This light wine has fruitiness and red-berry flavors. That freshness is spoilt by bitter acidity that cuts through and gives the wine a tight, hard edge.                      Roger Voss
Name: Vignobles Gabriel and Co. 2019 La Closerie Saint-Vincent Grand Pavillon Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A reduced, earthy aroma is followed by rather thin fruit and nut flavors in this light-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sol Rouge 2019 Rosé (Lake County)

Description: Intensely fruity yet fascinatingly complex, La Reine des Bois consistently reigns as one of the best wines from Tavel. This vintage offers profound, mouthwatering black-cherry and cassis flavors accented by strikes of crushed stone and sizzling black spice. It's lush and velvety through a long, delicately tannic finish. Lovely already, the wine will drink beautifully through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine de la Mordorée 2019 La Reine des Bois  (Tavel)

Description: Year after year, this mouthwatering rosé is an approachably priced, stand-out pick amid an excellent lineup of Tavel bottlings. It's weighty and concentrated yet always invigorating, packed with crisp-tart blackberry and black-cherry flavors marked by complexities of bramble, garrigue and earth. A wine worth drinking beyond the summer months, it should fare beautifully through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château d'Aqueria 2019  Tavel

Description: Perfumed notes of fresh boysenberry and black cherry are lifted by a cutting mineral edge in this rosé. Black fruit flavors are intensely ripe and penetrating, accented by shavings of black pepper and a firm, fine-grained grip of tannins. This solidly structured, thrilling wine should improve through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine de la Mordorée 2019 La Dame Rousse  (Tavel)

Description: This wine takes the concept of Provence rosé to the extreme. The wood aging is beautifully integrated while a whisper of toastiness adds to the richness and concentration. A deliciously textured rosé, its weight and density make it perfect for food. Enjoy in the near term.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château d'Esclans 2018 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a well crafted, fresh and nervy wine, tasting of tart strawberry, lime and dried herb. Textured and lively, it satisfies in balanced complexity and well-tamed acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Brick & Mortar 2015 Sweetwater Springs Sparkling Rosé (Russian River Valley)

Description: Having spent four months in stainless steel, this crisp, lively and sophisticated wine blends together 47% Malbec, 24% Merlot and 29% Cabernet Franc, made by legendary winemaker Heidi Barrett. Cranberry, rose petal and Meyer lemon give it fruity sublimity within a structured, high-acid frame.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kenzo Estate 2019 Yui Rosé (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very brisk and yet immensely comforting on the nose, this bottling offers judicious aromas of strawberry-banana bubblegum and crushed seashell. The palate is tightly woven, allowing light brushes of peach and melon to ride the zesty acidity that carries deep into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Andrew Murray 2019 Esperance Curtis Vineyard Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lightly perfume aromas of soft pink rose petals, papaya and bubblegum are delicate and delicious on the nose of this rosé blend of 64% Syrah and 36% Grenache. There's a boost of acidity on the racy palate, where a high-toned structure releases flavors of cantaloupe and red melon.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Refugio Ranch 2019 Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This intensely plummy, black-fruited rosé offers a fantastic, well-priced alternative to this producer's increasingly expensive flagship Tavel. A full-bodied, voluminous blend of Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault, it's luminous and concentrated but freshly balanced by strikes of cut stone and salt. Drink now through 2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine de la Mordorée 2019 La Dame Rousse Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh cotton-candy and watermelon aromas meet with a tangerine-juice acidity and chalky underside on the nose of this bottling. There's a solid zing to the sip, where a grippy texture carries just a hint of delicious strawberry.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Solminer 2019 Linus Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This is a blend of Syrah, Grenache Noir and Blanc, Viognier, Marsanne and Pinot Noir. Together, they explode on the palate in waves of bright, high-toned strawberry and grapefruit, with texture and stony crispness. The nose is a mix of candied cherry and rose water.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Three Sticks 2019 Casteñada Rosé (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Fresh and elegant, this rosé made from 100% Xinomavro starts with aromas of rose, strawberry and tropical fruit. The palate is dry and crisp but full of strawberry and saline flavors. Its structure and full, fruity body make it a great pairing for spicy cuisine and grilled fare.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Alpha Estate 2018 Single Vineyard Hedgehog Rosé (Amyndeon)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A pristine strawberry aroma meets with bubblegum, cotton candy and rose petal on the nose of this Grenache-based rosé. There's a great chalky grip to the sip, where light lime and soft strawberry flavors ride sizzling acidity into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Folded Hills 2019 Lilly Estate Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This wood-aged wine has a good balance between spicy toast and ripe red fruits. It is rich, with a dense structure and impressive concentration. The extra year after harvest has given the wine depth and a smooth maturity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château d'Esclans 2018 Les Clans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Description: A rare Mourvèdre-dominant rosé blended with Grenache and Syrah, this richly concentrated sip offers concentrated raspberry and red-plum flavors. More than just a poolside quaffer, this substantial, mouth-filling rosé should appeal to lovers of crisp red wines. Delightful now, it should drink beautifully well past the summer.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine de la Citadelle 2019 Les Artemes Rosé (Luberon)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Steely and crisp on the nose, this Cabernet Franc-based pink shows bright strawberry and crushed chalk aromas. There is a tactile precision to the grippy palate, where that chalk element dominates, with pops of pluot flesh arising as well.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Piocho 2019 Rosé (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Well-balanced and refreshing, this dry wine blends mineral and chalk aspects with tasty raspberry flavors. It is a slightly restrained, elegant expression that will please many.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Schramsberg 2017 Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Rosé (North Coast)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the inaugural rosé from this venerable winery, and it's a home run. Pale peach in color, with aromas offering notes of bubblegum, strawberry and tangerine. Snappy, mouthwatering flavors follow and linger on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2019 Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh aromas of rose petal, watermelon, bubblegum and squeezed lime show on the nose of this pink blend of 56% Mourvèdre, 26% Grenache and 18% Cinsault. There's a great sizzle to the sip, where a crushed seashell minerality wraps up flavors of light orange and delicate strawberry.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Le P'tit Paysan 2019 Pierre's Piroette Rosé (Central Coast)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This small-production offering is made from Syrah grown on Samantha's Vineyard. It excels at capturing cool-climate acidity at low sugars, staying fresh and crisp on in the glass—a tart experience of apple skin, Asian pear and lemon peel.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacLaren 2018 Kenzie Rosé (Russian River Valley)

Description: Freshly picked red cherries and strawberries are etched by tangs of salt and crushed mineral in this vibrant blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Full bodied but spirited, it's a zesty Tavel that's quaffable by the pool but solid enough to accompany grilled lamb or beef.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Alain Jaume et Fils 2019 Le Crétacé  (Tavel)

Description: Mouthwatering notes of raspberries, wild strawberry and watermelon introduce this joyously fruity 70–30 blend of Grenache and Syrah. It's a scintillating, primary expression of Tavel that maintains an elegant mineral undertow and a fine fringe of tannins that lingers on the finish. At peak now, the wine should hold nicely through 2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Cellier des Chartreux 2019 Domaine Les Hautes Roches  (Tavel)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale salmon in color, with aromas of watermelon, mineral and herbs leading to juicy, mouthwatering flavors with a tart finish. It's thoroughly delightful—everything you want from a rosé.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Frog Kisser 2019 Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: The top wine in the Cavalier range, this is densely textured, with hints of minerality as well as fresh red fruits that convey extra richness and density. All this makes for a wine that is ready to drink but that could age for a several months.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cavalier 2018 Grand Cavalier Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is made from Pinot Noir, and it's a light, crisp and delightfully fruity wine that will appeal across a wide range of palates. Strawberry and cherry flavors highlight a thread of lasting acidity and sumptuous softness that lingers playfully on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lady Finger 2018 Rosé (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale salmon in color, with aromas of watermelon, mineral and herbs leading to juicy, mouthwatering flavors with a tart finish. It's thoroughly delightful—everything you want from a rosé.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Frog Kisser 2019 Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Single-vineyard rosés remain a relative rarity in the state. This wine is half Grenache and half Mourvèdre. Pale bronze in color, with light aromas and notes of mineral and strawberry. Fresh, juicy, medium-bodied flavors follow, bringing a lovely sense of texture and purity. A long finish caps it off. The acidity balance is lovely. More, please.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kerloo 2019 Lonesome Springs Ranch Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A darker salmon shade in the glass, this bottling offers watermelon, ripe cherry and orange-rind-cranberry tones on the nose. There's plenty of zip to the sip, where rounded and full fruit flavors are cut by fresh acidity, earthy spice and a chalky grip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Larner 2018 Rosé (Ballard Canyon)

Description: A deeper pink hue suggests more body on this pink wine while the wild berry notes on the nose have a certain creaminess. The palate has a lovely rounded nature, more of htat creaminess and the kind of red berry juiciness that has the merest edge of nettle spice. This is a pink wine en route to red with lovely texture and a dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Umathum 2019 Rosa Rosé (Burgenland)

Appellation: Les Baux de Provence, Provence, France
Description: A blend of Grenache, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Mourvèdre, this is a rich, scintillating wine. It pulsates with freshness as well as ripe berry flavors. Lightly structured, it is all about fruitiness, with crisp acidity at the end. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Mas de la Dame 2019 La Gourmande Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

Description: Crisp, ripe red fruits sing from this attractive wine. It is rich, but with acidity and tannins from the 60% Mourvèdre in the blend, it also has structure and freshness. Drink the wine from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Moulin de la Roque 2019 Les Adrets Rosé (Bandol)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is half Grenache and half Mourvèdre. Pale in color, with fresh aromas of kiwi, strawberry and melon leading to medium-bodied flavors that bring some weight and seriousness but have more than enough acidity to stand them up. Sour cherry flavors linger on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pursued by Bear 2019 Blushing Bear Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Rose petals and wild mint perfume juicy strawberry and watermelon in this full-bodied but zesty blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah. A pretty salmon color in the glass, it's a juicy, pristinely fruity sip that finishes on peppery hits of spice and tannin. This versatile rosé carries seamlessly from aperitifs through dinner.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine de la Citadelle 2019 Le Chataignier Rosé (Luberon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A pretty copper-rose hue, this blend of 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay offers a mix of cherry, light citrus and lemon rind flavors, highlighted with gin-like botanicals. It's estate-grown and done in the méthode Champenoise style. Disgorged in mid-summer of 2019, the wine is still quite young, but already shows finesse and lingering details that portend further development in the bottle.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pashey 2016 Brut Rosé (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Salty mineral notes and a pleasant tickle of spritz introduce this zesty, full-bodied blend of Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault. Salmon-pink in hue, it offers juicy sour-cherry and wild strawberry flavors balanced freshly by a cutting red-currant lift. An ideal summer aperitif, it's at peak now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: M. Chapoutier 2019 Belleruche Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: This cotton-candy pink wine is a blend of 56% Malbec and 44% Merlot. High toned in acidity and lushly layered on the palate in Meyer lemon, cherry and vanilla, it is hearty, herbal and substantially weighty in texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2019 Yoshino Rosé (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: This zesty Cab Franc rosé is all about lifted tones of pink grapefruit, wild strawberry and crushed stone. It's light in profile, but not lacking in intensity, with a slightly creamy feel that's held in check by juicy acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Fjord 2019 Cabernet Franc Rosé (Hudson River Region)

Description: A touch of reduction adds a flinty glint to the tender berry and lemon notes on the nose. The palate comes in with vivid lemon freshness that lends contour and verve to the tender forest fruit notes. The palate is dry and superfresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Iby 2019 Blaufränkisch Rosé (Burgenland)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean lines of cantaloupe rind and guava peel show on the nose of this bottling. The palate hits with a steely tension, offering brisk lemon and pink-fruit flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: San Simeon 2019 Stefano Vineyard Grenache Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: Smooth and luxurious, this rich and balanced wine layers persimmon and ginger over white cherry and raspberry for a complex and delicious expression. It is smooth, medium bodied and balanced toward the soft side.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Domaine Chandon NV Brut Rosé (California)

Description: Fiery notes of peppercorn and char introduce this piquant blend of Cinsault (60%) and Grenache (40%). Blackberry and plum flavors are crisply concentrated on the palate and shaded by savory plumes of smoke and char. It's perfect for lovers of spicy red wines or as an accompaniment to steak or game.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Maby 2019 Prima Donna  (Tavel)

Description: This wine is all about attractive red fruits. It is crisp, fresh and poised between red-currant and raspberry flavors, with lovely bright acidity. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Cavalier 2018 Cuvée Marafiance Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Description: This is a rich rosé, full bodied and packed with flavor. Ripe red berries are full of sweet juice, giving the wine acidity and a warm character. A touch of caramel comes through at the end. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Delaporte 2018 Rosé (Sancerre)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The second vintage of this wine comes from a single block of this vineyard, planted in 1999. Pale peach in color, with subdued aromas and notes of cherry, strawberry and herbs. It's broad in feel, while the acidity brings an appealing sense of freshness.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Eight Bells 2019 Red Willow Vineyard Mourvèdre Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Description: This ripe wine is packed with warm strawberry fruits, lightly touched by acidity. Juicy, perfumed and with an attractive spicy character, it has weight, richness and density, with a fine bite of pepper at the end. Drink from late 2020.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château d'Esclans 2019 Rock Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A blend of 80% Pinot Noir and 20% Chardonnay, this sparkling wine starts off with aromas of button mushroom, raspberry and a hint of cream. The palate is driven by tart red fruit, yet it is filled out nicely by a creamy mousse and a savory blanched almond tone.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lieb 2017 Estate Sparkling Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Lemon and hints of strawberry compote are appetizing on the nose. The palate comes in with zingy freshness that lifts and brightens the entire wine. The lemon finish is bone dry and vivid.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Netzl 2019 Rosanna Rosé (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A pale shade of pink in the glass, this rosé offers aromas of cotton candy and strawberry set against a chalky backdrop. It's brisk on the sip, with struck stone and a lively strawberry tone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Noble Vines 2019 515 Rosé (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sangiovese makes up over two-thirds of this wine, with the rest Syrah. A very appealing pale salmon color, with bright aromas of fresh melon, watermelon and strawberry followed by dry juicy, medium-bodied tangerine and melon flavors supported by lively acidity. It brings a whole lot of appeal.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: SoDo 2019 Love Birds Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A fresh, perfumed wine, this is poised and stylish. Red-currant fruits shine through the light texture and attractive acidity. With 50% Grenache in the blend, the wine has a typical touch of pepper. Drink this fresh, crisp wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Solière 2019 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Description: Ripe strawberry, lemon and pepper make for a most appetizing nose. The light-bodied palate empahsizes the citrus freshness as well as the spicy berry roundness and comes to a fresh, dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Biokult 2019 Made With Organic Grapes Zweigelt Rosé (Burgenland)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a blend of Cinsault (56%) and Grenache. Pale salmon in color, with aromas of yellow strawberry, green melon rind and citrus, followed by a medium-bodied, flavorful, almost viscous palate that's chock-full of strawberry flavors. It's equal parts serious and whimsical.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Have a Nice Day Olsen Vineyard
Name: Two Vintners 2019 Have a Nice Day Olsen Vineyard Rosé (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: For how dark the shade of pink is in the glass, this is a rather tightly wound rosé, starting with aromas of cherry, orange peel and turned earth. The palate is also lighter than expected, showing berry, rose petals and cracked pepper flavors, all clinging to a taut texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Villa Creek 2019 Rosé (Paso Robles)

Description: Made from Niellucciu (aka Sangiovese), this wine is full, soft and ripe. Its light texture and hints of tannins contrast with the acidity and rich raspberry flavors. This intense, full wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Clos Alivu 2019 Rosé (Patrimonio)

Description: This delicious wine is rosé by virtue of the pink color of the Pinot Gris skin, taking the concept of blush to the extreme of paleness. Attractive and fruity, it has the lightest texture and the typical floral perfumes of Pinot Gris. Drink this wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Cordaillat 2019 Rosé (Reuilly)

Description: This rosé of Cabernet and Merlot offers a refined and mineral-driven style that starts with strawberry and currant aromas, followed by exotic but balanced spice and dark-berry flavors. Good acidity and a lingering spicy finish give the wine focus and finesse. Imagine pairing this with grilled seafood or Thai cuisine.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2018 Amethystos Rosé (Drama)

Description: A ripe style of rosé from Rhône producer Jean-Luc Colombo, this is soft, fruity and attractively crisp. Bright red fruits shine, resulting in a fresh yet rich wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2019 La Dame du Rouet Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Description: A yeasty note of cured ham is noted on this lightly oaked high-end Rioja rosé. A fresh palate, with a woody texture, offers flavors of oak grain, peach and cantaloupe prior to a steady, fresh finish that reverberates with oak and minerally notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Muga 2018 Flor De Muga Rosé (Rioja)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: A light shade of pink, this rosé begins with aromas of light red currant, rose petal and a touch of turned earth. There's an earthy tone to the palate as well as dried strawberry and cotton-candy flavors, with a rocky minerality evident throughout the sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Akash 2019 Parlez Vous Rosé (Temecula Valley)
